original: de la snang ba ni 'gro ba'i chos can yin te /
analyzed: de la snang ba ni 'gro ba'i chos can yin te /
translated: Light is a phenomenon that moves,

original: chu rlabs kyi tshul mthar gyis yul gnod pa na gang gi tshe mun pa dang bar ma chod pa'i snang ba'i skad cig skyed par byed pa de'i tshe snang ba dang nye ba'i mun pa sel ba med par skyed par byed do //
analyzed: chu rlabs kyi tshul mthar gyis yul gnod pa na gang gi tshe mun pa dang bar ma chod pa'i snang ba'i skad cig skyed par byed pa de'i tshe snang ba dang nye ba'i mun pa sel ba med par skyed par byed do //
translated: just like waves. When it gradually reaches a place that is in darkness, if it produces an instant of light that is not obstructed by darkness, then at that time it produces light without dispelling the darkness that is adjacent to it.

original: des na snang ba dang nye bar 'dug pa gang yin pa de nus pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na snang ba dang nye bar 'dug pa gang yin pa de nus pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the light that is adjacent to the darkness would be ineffective.

original: mun pa med de 'gags pa dang yul der snang ba skyed de /
analyzed: mun pa med de 'gags pa dang yul der snang ba skyed de /
translated: Darkness does not exist there, because it has been stopped. Light produces light in that place.

original: de ltar na rim gyis snang bas mun pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na rim gyis snang bas mun pa sel bar byed do //
translated: In this way, light gradually dispels darkness.

original: dro ba'i reg pas grang ba'i reg pa zlog pa'i tshul yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dro ba'i reg pas grang ba'i reg pa zlog pa'i tshul yang de bzhin no //
translated: The way that a warm sensation stops a cold sensation is similar.

original: gang gi tshe mun nag gi yul de nyid du snang ba skyed par byed pa de'i tshe skad cig gang la mun nag gi yul du snang ba skyed pa'i skad cig ma skyed pa de nyid las mun pa ni mun pa gzhan la nus pa med par 'byung
analyzed: gang gi tshe mun nag gi yul de nyid du snang ba skyed par byed pa de'i tshe skad cig gang la mun nag gi yul du snang ba skyed pa'i skad cig ma skyed pa de nyid las mun pa ni mun pa gzhan la nus pa med par 'byung
translated: Darkness does not arise from another darkness, because it is powerless.

original: ngo // de ltar na nus pa med pa'i gnas skabs na skyed par byed ba nyid kyi sgo nas zlog par byed pas 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: ngo // de ltar na nus pa med pa'i gnas skabs na skyed par byed ba nyid kyi sgo nas zlog par byed pas 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, when it is powerless, it is dispelled by the producer, and so there is a contradiction.

original: de bas na skad cig gang la skyed par byed pa de la ci ste myur bar zlog par byed na skad cig gsum pa la zlog par byed pas 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na skad cig gang la skyed par byed pa de la ci ste myur bar zlog par byed na skad cig gsum pa la zlog par byed pas 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, if it is dispelled quickly at the very moment when it is produced, then there is a contradiction because it is dispelled in the third moment.

original: bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir rgyun gnyis 'gal ba yin gyi /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir rgyun gnyis 'gal ba yin gyi /
translated: The two continua are contradictory because they are the entities of the produced and the producer.

original: skad cig ma gnyis ni 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis ni 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: Two moments are not contradictory.

original: ci ste rgyun ces bya ba dngos por yod pa ma yin pa de lta na rgyun can dngos por gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: ci ste rgyun ces bya ba dngos por yod pa ma yin pa de lta na rgyun can dngos por gyur pa yin no //
translated: But if the so-called continuum does not exist as a real entity, then the things that are in the continuum would exist as real entities.

original: des na don dam par ni skad cig ma gnyis ni 'gal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: des na don dam par ni skad cig ma gnyis ni 'gal ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, in the ultimate sense, two moments are not contradictory.

original: 'on kyang skad cig ma mang po rnams yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang skad cig ma mang po rnams yin te /
translated: However, many moments are.

original: 'di ltar sreg par byed pa'i skad cig ma yod pa grang ba'i skad cig ma byung du zin kyang 'gag pa'i chos can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sreg par byed pa'i skad cig ma yod pa grang ba'i skad cig ma byung du zin kyang 'gag pa'i chos can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Thus, even if the moment of heat exists, the moment of cold would arise as a thing that has the property of cessation.

original: rgyu gnyis bzlog par bya ba dang bzlog par byed pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan gyi 'gal bar gnas pa na yang rdul phra rab thams cad yul gcig na gnas pa med kyang 'gal ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis bzlog par bya ba dang bzlog par byed pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan gyi 'gal bar gnas pa na yang rdul phra rab thams cad yul gcig na gnas pa med kyang 'gal ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Even when the reason for the contradiction is the reversal of the two causes and the reversal of the cause, if they are in contradiction, all the atoms do not exist in one place, but they are not in contradiction.

original: de dag rgyun gcig la gcig zlog par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag rgyun gcig la gcig zlog par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they do not reverse each other in one continuum.

original: @77a * // 'gro ba'i chos can gyi snang bas yul gang zhig gnod par byed pa'i yul de na gnas pa'i 'gal ba'i rgyun zlog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: @77a * // 'gro ba'i chos can gyi snang bas yul gang zhig gnod par byed pa'i yul de na gnas pa'i 'gal ba'i rgyun zlog par byed pa yin no //
translated: The light of the lamp, which is the subject of the property of illumination, does not dispel the darkness that is in contact with it.

original: de bas na khang pa'i grva'i phyogs gcig na gnas pa'i sgron ma'i 'od mun pa dang nye bar gnas kyang mun pa sel bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na khang pa'i grva'i phyogs gcig na gnas pa'i sgron ma'i 'od mun pa dang nye bar gnas kyang mun pa sel bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The light of the lamp that is in one part of the house does not dispel the darkness that is in another part.

original: mun pas non pa'i phyogs su snang ba'i skad cig ma gzhan skyed par nus pa'i phyir ro //🔽rgyu nus pa med pa'i bya ba'i rgyu mtshan can gyi 'gal ba ni rgyun la gnas pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mun pas non pa'i phyogs su snang ba'i skad cig ma gzhan skyed par nus pa'i phyir ro // rgyu nus pa med pa'i bya ba'i rgyu mtshan can gyi 'gal ba ni rgyun la gnas pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is able to produce another moment of light in the place occupied by the darkness.

original: byung ba zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: byung ba zhes pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the reason for the incompatibility of the non-existent is the non-existence of the cause, he says:🔽The arising of the cold touch is the non-existence of the hot touch.

original: grang ba'i reg pa rgyun rgyud mar 'jug pa 'byung ba la gzhan dro ba'i reg pa rgyun yod na med pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: grang ba'i reg pa rgyun rgyud mar 'jug pa 'byung ba la gzhan dro ba'i reg pa rgyun yod na med pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The arising of the cold touch in a continuous series is the non-existence of the hot touch in a continuous series.

original: gang dag 'gal ba ni dngos por yod pa ma yin no zhes smras pa de la 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gang dag 'gal ba ni dngos por yod pa ma yin no zhes smras pa de la 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: To those who say that the incompatible does not exist as a thing, this should be said:

original: ji ltar 'bras bu ma skyes pa la bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba gnyis la gnas pa yod pa ma yin yang 'bras bu yod pa ni rgyu sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa de bas na dngos po nyid yin🔽no // de bzhin du ldog pa'i dngos po la ni 'gal ba zhes bya ba gnyis la 'gal ba yod pa ma yin yang /
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu ma skyes pa la bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba gnyis la gnas pa yod pa ma yin yang 'bras bu yod pa ni rgyu sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa de bas na dngos po nyid yin no // de bzhin du ldog pa'i dngos po la ni 'gal ba zhes bya ba gnyis la 'gal ba yod pa ma yin yang /
translated: Just as, although the non-arisen effect and the so-called entity that is to be produced and the producer do not exist in the two, the existent effect has a cause that precedes it, therefore, it is an existent entity.

original: me'i rgyu mtshan gyis grang ba'i reg pa'i skad cig ma gzhan la nus pa med par 'gyur de bas na 'gal ba yang dngos po yod pa kho na yin no ;
analyzed: me'i rgyu mtshan gyis grang ba'i reg pa'i skad cig ma gzhan la nus pa med par 'gyur de bas na 'gal ba yang dngos po yod pa kho na yin no ;
translated: Similarly, although the so-called entity that is to be stopped and the so-called entity that stops do not exist in the two, the entity that is to be stopped is stopped by the entity that stops, therefore, stopping is also an existent entity.

original: / dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the example, he says:

original: grang ba dang tsha ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grang ba dang tsha ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: cold and hot.

original: de dag nyid reg pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag nyid reg pa yin te /
translated: They are contact.

original: de gnyis bzhin no //
analyzed: de gnyis bzhin no //
translated: They are like those two.

original: grang ba dang dro ba'i reg pa gnyis kyi 'gal ba yang snga ma de dag bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: grang ba dang dro ba'i reg pa gnyis kyi 'gal ba yang snga ma de dag bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The contradiction between the two contacts of cold and hot should be applied in the same way as the previous ones.

original: 'gal ba gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gal ba gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the second contradiction, he says:

original: gcig gis gcig spangs te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gcig gis gcig spangs te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “Mutually exclusive” means

original: yongs su dor ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su dor ba'o //
translated: to be completely abandoned.

original: des gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de ngo bo nyid gang dag la yod pa de'i dngos po ni gcig gis gcig spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: des gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de ngo bo nyid gang dag la yod pa de'i dngos po ni gcig gis gcig spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The nature of those that have the characteristic of being mutually exclusive is the entity of mutual exclusion.

original: 'di la gang yongs su gcod pa na gang rnam par gcod pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la gang yongs su gcod pa na gang rnam par gcod pa ste /
translated: In this regard, when something is determined, something else is excluded.

original: yongs su gcod pa zhes bya ba de ni rnam par gcad par bya ba yongs su spangs te gnas pa'i ngo bor blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su gcod pa zhes bya ba de ni rnam par gcad par bya ba yongs su spangs te gnas pa'i ngo bor blta bar bya'o //
translated: That which is called “determination” should be regarded as the nature of being mutually exclusive, completely abandoning that which is to be excluded.

original: sngon po yongs su gcod pa na yang de'i ngo bo nyams par bcad pa yin te /
analyzed: sngon po yongs su gcod pa na yang de'i ngo bo nyams par bcad pa yin te /
translated: When blue is determined, the nature of that which is excluded is eliminated.

original: de rnam par ma bcad na sngon po yongs su mi gcod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnam par ma bcad na sngon po yongs su mi gcod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if that were not excluded, it would follow that blue would not be determined.

original: de bas na dngos po rnams kyi yod pa dang med @77b pa gnyis ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i ngo bo yin la /
analyzed: de bas na dngos po rnams kyi yod pa dang med @77b pa gnyis ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i ngo bo yin la /
translated: Therefore, the existence and nonexistence of things are mutually exclusive natures.

original: sngon po las gzhan pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni sngon po'i dngos po med pa la mi 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: sngon po las gzhan pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni sngon po'i dngos po med pa la mi 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: Whatever nature is other than blue is not mistaken with respect to the nonexistence of blue,

original: sngon po ltar rung ba ser po la sogs pa dmigs pa na ni dmigs pas med par nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po ltar rung ba ser po la sogs pa dmigs pa na ni dmigs pas med par nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when one observes yellow, etc., which is suitable as blue, one ascertains the nonexistence of blue through observation.

original: ji ltar sngon po ni dngos po med pa yongs su spong bar byed pa de bzhin du ser po la sogs pa med pa la mi 'khrul ba la yang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sngon po ni dngos po med pa yongs su spong bar byed pa de bzhin du ser po la sogs pa med pa la mi 'khrul ba la yang yin no //
translated: Just as blue excludes nonexistence, so also yellow, etc., are not mistaken with respect to the nonexistence of blue.

original: da ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis ni dngos su 'gal ba yin la /
analyzed: da ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis ni dngos su 'gal ba yin la /
translated: Now, existence and nonexistence are directly contradictory,

original: dngos po ni med pa la mi 'khrul ba las 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po ni med pa la mi 'khrul ba las 'gal ba yin no //
translated: and existence is contradictory with nonmistakenness with respect to nonexistence.

original: yang gang zhig gzhan la med par nges she na /
analyzed: yang gang zhig gzhan la med par nges she na /
translated: Moreover, how is one ascertained as nonexistent in another?

original: gang rnam pa nges pa dang ldan pa'i don yin gyi /
analyzed: gang rnam pa nges pa dang ldan pa'i don yin gyi /
translated: The meaning is that one is ascertained as having a specific aspect,

original: rnam pa ma nges pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa ma nges pa ni ma yin te /
translated: not as having an indefinite aspect,

original: skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like momentariness, etc.

original: skad cig ma nyid ni sngon po la sogs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid ni sngon po la sogs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid yin te /
translated: Momentariness is the nature of all things, such as blue, etc.

original: des na rnam pa nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam pa nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the form is not ascertained.

original: de bas na skad cig ma nyid spangs par snang ba ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de bas na skad cig ma nyid spangs par snang ba ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no appearance that is excluded from momentariness.

original: gal te de na dngos po med pa yang rnam par ma nges par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de na dngos po med pa yang rnam par ma nges par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is said that non-existence there is also not ascertained,

original: rnam pa nges pa zhes bya bar ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa nges pa zhes bya bar ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: how could it be called ascertained?

original: gang gi phyir dngos po med pa ni ngo bos dben pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po med pa ni ngo bos dben pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: Because non-existence is a conception of the absence of an entity.

original: de bas na mthong ba 'am brtag pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bas na mthong ba 'am brtag pa yang rung ste /
translated: Therefore, whether seen or imagined,

original: nges pa'i rang bzhin nyid gzhan la med par nges pa yin gyi ma nges pa zhes bya bar /
analyzed: nges pa'i rang bzhin nyid gzhan la med par nges pa yin gyi ma nges pa zhes bya bar /
translated: the ascertained nature does not exist elsewhere. It is not called uncertain.

original: de ltar na brtag pa dang 'dre la sogs pa yang rnam pa nges pa brtags pa yin par lta bar 'di ni bdag nyid gcig par 'gal bar yang yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na brtag pa dang 'dre la sogs pa yang rnam pa nges pa brtags pa yin par lta bar 'di ni bdag nyid gcig par 'gal bar yang yin te /
translated: Thus, even the examination of the ascertained form and so on is seen as the examination of the ascertained aspect. This is contradictory to the assertion of a single nature.

original: gang zhig phan tshun spangs te gnas pa de dag ni gcig pa nyid med pa yin no ;
analyzed: gang zhig phan tshun spangs te gnas pa de dag ni gcig pa nyid med pa yin no ;
translated: Those that exist in mutual exclusion do not have a single nature.

original: / de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni mtshan nyid las gyur pa'i 'gal ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: / de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni mtshan nyid las gyur pa'i 'gal ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, this is called “contradiction by way of the characteristic.”

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin 'di'i dgos pa yin pas so //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin 'di'i dgos pa yin pas so //
translated: Because this is the purpose of the nature of things.

original: 'gal ba 'dis ni dngos po'i de nyid tha dad par rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba 'dis ni dngos po'i de nyid tha dad par rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin no //
translated: By this contradiction, the reality of things is established as different.

original: de nyid kyi phyir snang ba'i rang bzhin la 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni snang ba nyid du khas blangs nas dgag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir snang ba'i rang bzhin la 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni snang ba nyid du khas blangs nas dgag par bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, when you refute the nature of light, you refute it by accepting that it is light.🔽When you refute yellow, for example, you refute it by accepting that it is light.

original: 'di ltar dngos po med pa dang sha za yang gang gi tshe ser po la 'gog par 'dod pa de'i tshe snang ba'i bdag nyid kho nas dgag par bya ba yin pas snang ba nyid du khas blangs nas dgag par bya ba yin te /🔽'di ltar dngos po @78a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po med pa dang sha za yang gang gi tshe ser po la 'gog par 'dod pa de'i tshe snang ba'i bdag nyid kho nas dgag par bya ba yin pas snang ba nyid du khas blangs nas dgag par bya ba yin te /🔽'di ltar dngos po @78a * //
translated: Therefore, you refute it by accepting that it is light.

original: med pa dang sha za yang gang gi tshe ser po la 'gog par 'dod pa de'i tshe snang ba'i bdag nyid kho na dgag par bya ba yin pas snang ba nyid du khas blangs nas snang ba mi dmigs pa kho na las 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa dang sha za yang gang gi tshe ser po la 'gog par 'dod pa de'i tshe snang ba'i bdag nyid kho na dgag par bya ba yin pas snang ba nyid du khas blangs nas snang ba mi dmigs pa kho na las 'gog pa yin no //
translated: And when one wishes to refute the yellow color of a ghost or a flesh-eater, it is the very nature of the appearance that is to be refuted. Therefore, one must accept the appearance and then refute it on the basis of the non-apprehension of the appearance.

original: de lta na yang gcig gi ngo bo la yang yongs su bcad pa na de med pa'i ltar rung ba rnam par gcad par bya ba yin zhing /
analyzed: de lta na yang gcig gi ngo bo la yang yongs su bcad pa na de med pa'i ltar rung ba rnam par gcad par bya ba yin zhing /
translated: Even so, when one ascertains the nature of one, the other is excluded.

original: gang zhig de med pa la nges pa'i rnam pa can gyi bltar rung ba de yang snang ba rnam par gcad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig de med pa la nges pa'i rnam pa can gyi bltar rung ba de yang snang ba rnam par gcad par bya ba yin te /
translated: And that which is capable of appearing in the form of the ascertainment of the absence of the other is also excluded from the appearance.

original: des na rang nyams pa bzhin du nyams pa dang ldan pa yang rnam par gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rang nyams pa bzhin du nyams pa dang ldan pa yang rnam par gcod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the exclusion of the one is the inclusion of the other, and the exclusion of the other is the inclusion of the one.

original: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de thams cad ni des gcig pa nyid bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de thams cad ni des gcig pa nyid bkag pa yin te /
translated: And that which is mutually exclusive is all excluded from the one, since the one is excluded from it.

original: des na 'gal ba 'di yod kyang lhan cig tu gnas par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'gal ba 'di yod kyang lhan cig tu gnas par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even though there is this contradiction, they do exist simultaneously.

original: de'i phyir 'gal ba gnyis kyi byed pa tha dad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gal ba gnyis kyi byed pa tha dad de /
translated: Therefore, the two contradictory actions are different.

original: gcig gis ni grang ba dang dro ba'i reg pa dag gcig pa nyid 'gog par byed la /
analyzed: gcig gis ni grang ba dang dro ba'i reg pa dag gcig pa nyid 'gog par byed la /
translated: One action stops the sameness of the cold and warm sensations,

original: gzhan gyis ni lhan cig tu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni lhan cig tu gnas pa'o //
translated: while the other stops their simultaneous presence.

original: yul yang tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: yul yang tha dad pa yin te /
translated: The objects are also different.

original: phan tshun spangs pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa mtha' dag la yin la /
analyzed: phan tshun spangs pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa mtha' dag la yin la /
translated: Mutual exclusion is of all things and nonthings,

original: lhan cig tu mi gnas pa'i 'gal ba ni dngos po nyid 'ba' zhig la yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig tu mi gnas pa'i 'gal ba ni dngos po nyid 'ba' zhig la yin no //
translated: while the contradiction of nonsimultaneous presence is of things alone.

original: de bas na byed pa tha dad pa dang yul tha dad pa yin pa de'i phyir 'di nyid gcig gi nang du 'dus pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na byed pa tha dad pa dang yul tha dad pa yin pa de'i phyir 'di nyid gcig gi nang du 'dus pa med do //
translated: Therefore, because the actions and objects are different, they are not included in one another.

original: 'gal ba rnam pa de gnyis ka yang smra ba nyid dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'di gnyis la mi srid de /
analyzed: 'gal ba rnam pa de gnyis ka yang smra ba nyid dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'di gnyis la mi srid de /
translated: Both of these two types of contradiction are impossible for both speech and omniscience.

original: 'di ltar rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni smra ba nyid yod pa'i phyir med par rtog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni smra ba nyid yod pa'i phyir med par rtog pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, omniscience, whose cause is not incomplete, is not imagined to be nonexistent because of the existence of speech.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni mi snang ba yin la ;
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni mi snang ba yin la ;
translated: Omniscience is not manifest,

original: mi snang ba yang dngos po med par nges par ma yin no //
analyzed: mi snang ba yang dngos po med par nges par ma yin no //
translated: and what is not manifest is not necessarily nonexistent.

original: de bas na 'dis ni gzhan dang 'gal bar rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dis ni gzhan dang 'gal bar rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this does not prove that omniscience is contradictory to something else.

original: smra ba nyid yongs su spangs te thams cad mkhyen pa gnas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: smra ba nyid yongs su spangs te thams cad mkhyen pa gnas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does omniscience exist by abandoning speech,

original: smra ba yongs su spangs pa'i shing la sogs pa de dag kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smra ba yongs su spangs pa'i shing la sogs pa de dag kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that trees and so on, which have abandoned speech, are omniscient.

original: smra ba nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su spangs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: smra ba nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su spangs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does omniscience exist by not abandoning speech,

original: shing la sogs pa yang smra ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa yang smra ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that trees and so on are omniscient.

original: 'gal ba med pa de nyid kyi phyir smra ba nyid kyis yod pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'gog par 'gyur @78b ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa de nyid kyi phyir smra ba nyid kyis yod pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'gog par 'gyur @78b ba ma yin no //
translated: Since there is no contradiction, it is not the case that omniscience is refuted by the fact that speech exists.

original: ci ste de lta de la 'gal ba med na bum pa dang snam bu gnyis bzhin du de gnyis kyang lhan cig tu gnas par snang bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: ci ste de lta de la 'gal ba med na bum pa dang snam bu gnyis bzhin du de gnyis kyang lhan cig tu gnas par snang bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If there were no contradiction in that, then those two would appear to exist together, like a pot and a cloth.

original: mi snang bas na 'gal ba snang ba yin la /
analyzed: mi snang bas na 'gal ba snang ba yin la /
translated: But since they do not appear, the contradiction appears.

original: 'gal ba'i phyir dngos po med par rtogs so snyam du dogs pa la /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir dngos po med par rtogs so snyam du dogs pa la /
translated: Thinking, “Because of the contradiction, I understand that there is no entity,”

original: mi 'gal ba bsgrub pa las ni zhes bya ba smos te /🔽mi dmigs kyang 'di 'gal bar grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi 'gal ba bsgrub pa las ni zhes bya ba smos te / mi dmigs kyang 'di 'gal bar grub pa ma yin no //
translated: he says, “The proof of non-contradiction . . . ”🔽Even though there is no observation, this is not established as a contradiction.

original: gal te yang lhan cig tu gnas pa ma dmigs pa de la yang 'on kyang de nyid 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang lhan cig tu gnas pa ma dmigs pa de la yang 'on kyang de nyid 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: Even though there is no observation of their coexistence, still, that alone is not a contradiction.

original: gang gi phyir lhan cig pa ma dmigs pa tsam gyis 'gal ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lhan cig pa ma dmigs pa tsam gyis 'gal ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Because mere non-observation of coexistence is not a contradiction.

original: 'on kyang gnyi ga dmigs pa na bzlog par bya ba zlog par byed pa'i dngos pos nges pa las yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang gnyi ga dmigs pa na bzlog par bya ba zlog par byed pa'i dngos pos nges pa las yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But rather, when both are observed, it is through the fact that the object of negation is negated that there is ascertainment.

original: de bas na ma dmigs su zin kyang smra ba nyid bsgrub pas ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na ma dmigs su zin kyang smra ba nyid bsgrub pas ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, even though there is no observation, it is not the case that the thesis is established.

original: de'i phyir de las gzhan med par rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de las gzhan med par rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not realized that there is nothing other than that.

original: de bzhin du smra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par rtog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du smra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par rtog pa ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, it is not imagined that there is attachment, etc. because there is speech, etc.

original: 'di ltar ci ste tshig la sogs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa yin na ni tshig la sogs pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa rtogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar ci ste tshig la sogs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa yin na ni tshig la sogs pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa rtogs par 'gyur na /
translated: If speech, etc. were the effect of attachment, etc., then attachment, etc. would be realized from speech, etc.

original: 'bras bu yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang ma yin te /
translated: But they are not the effect.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dod chags dang tshig la sogs pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por ma grub pa'i rgyu'i phyir 'bras bu ma yin pa de bas na 'di las rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang tshig la sogs pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por ma grub pa'i rgyu'i phyir 'bras bu ma yin pa de bas na 'di las rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because attachment, speech, etc. are not established as the entity of cause and effect. They are not the effect. Therefore, they are not realized from that.

original: tshig na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ma yin yang lhan cig tu rgyu ba yin no //
analyzed: tshig na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ma yin yang lhan cig tu rgyu ba yin no //
translated: Even though speech, etc. are not the effect of attachment, etc., they occur simultaneously.

original: de bas na 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig tu rgyu ba log pas tshig ldog go snyam du dogs pa la smras pa /
analyzed: de bas na 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig tu rgyu ba log pas tshig ldog go snyam du dogs pa la smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is suspected that speech is stopped by the cessation of the occurrence of attachment, etc.

original: don gzhan rgyu ma yin pa log pas lhan cig tu rgyu ba mthong ba tsam gyi sgo nas gzhan tshig la sogs pa ldog pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don gzhan rgyu ma yin pa log pas lhan cig tu rgyu ba mthong ba tsam gyi sgo nas gzhan tshig la sogs pa ldog pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The opposite of the other meaning, not being a cause, is not the opposite of words, etc.

original: de bas na smra ba nyid kyang yin la 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na smra ba nyid kyang yin la 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one would be a speaker and also be free from attachment, etc.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba na gang gi phyir gyi don te /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba na gang gi phyir gyi don te /
translated: “ Thus” means “because.”

original: de bas na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa las bzlog pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa la tshig la sogs pa ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa las bzlog pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa la tshig la sogs pa ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, one would doubt that words, etc. are the opposite of omniscience, which is the opposite of not being omniscient, and are the opposite of being endowed with attachment, etc.

original: de bas na tshig la sogs pa ma nges pa yin te /🔽de ltar tshul re re ma @79a * //
analyzed: de bas na tshig la sogs pa ma nges pa yin te / de ltar tshul re re ma @79a * //
translated: Therefore, words, etc. are not ascertained.

original: grub pa dang the tshom za bar gtan tshigs kyi skyon du smras nas /
analyzed: grub pa dang the tshom za bar gtan tshigs kyi skyon du smras nas /
translated: Thus, having stated that each method is inconclusive and doubtful as a fault of the reason,🔽he states that the reason is contradictory:

original: tshul gnyis ma grub pa dang the tshom za na gtan tshigs kyi skyon du smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: tshul gnyis ma grub pa dang the tshom za na gtan tshigs kyi skyon du smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: If one does not establish the two modes, or has doubts about them, then one is said to have a faulty reason.

original: tshul gnyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tshul gnyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus, he says, “the two modes.”

original: tshul gnyis phyin ci log tu grub par gyur na 'gal ba yin no //🔽tshul ni gsum yod pa de bas na bye brag shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul gnyis phyin ci log tu grub par gyur na 'gal ba yin no // tshul ni gsum yod pa de bas na bye brag shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If the two modes are established in a contradictory way, then there is a contradiction.

original: gnyis po gang gis zhes smos so //
analyzed: gnyis po gang gis zhes smos so //
translated: Since there are three modes, in order to distinguish them, he says, “by which two?”

original: khyad par can gyi rang bzhin ston pa ni //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi rang bzhin ston pa ni //
translated: The teaching of the specific nature is

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “existing in similar instances and not existing in dissimilar instances.”

original: phyin ci log tu grub pa'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu grub pa'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is to be connected with “established in a contradictory way.”

original: byas pa nyid dang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: byas pa nyid dang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: “Being produced” is a reason from the nature.

original: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: “Arising immediately upon the exertion” is a reason from effect.

original: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i skye ba dang shes pa ni brtsal ma thag tu byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i skye ba dang shes pa ni brtsal ma thag tu byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The arising and the cognition that occur immediately upon the exertion are called “arising immediately upon the exertion.”

original: skye ba ni skye ba bzhin pa'i rang bzhin la bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni skye ba bzhin pa'i rang bzhin la bya'o //
translated: Production is the nature of that which is produced.

original: shes pa ni shes bya'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: shes pa ni shes bya'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Knowledge is the effect of the object of knowledge.

original: de la 'dir ni brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i shes pa gzung ste /
analyzed: de la 'dir ni brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i shes pa gzung ste /
translated: Here, knowledge is understood to be that which arises immediately after the effort to know.

original: des na 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is a reason based on effect.

original: gtan tshigs 'di gnyis ni rtag pa nyid dang bsgrub pa la 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di gnyis ni rtag pa nyid dang bsgrub pa la 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: These two reasons are fallacious reasons that contradict the thesis of permanence.

original: ci'i phyir 'di gnyis 'gal ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di gnyis 'gal ba yin zhe na /
translated: Why are these two contradictory?

original: 'di gnyis kyi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “because of the certainty of the presence and absence of these two in the two, the similar and the dissimilar.”

original: mthun pa'i phyogs rtag pa la ni byas pa nyid dang brtsal ma thag tu byung ba gnyis med pa kho nar nges pa yin la /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs rtag pa la ni byas pa nyid dang brtsal ma thag tu byung ba gnyis med pa kho nar nges pa yin la /
translated: It is certain that production and arising immediately after effort are absent only in the similar class, the permanent.🔽It is certain that they are present only in the dissimilar class, the impermanent.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi rtag pa nyid kho na la yod par nges par phyin ci log tu grub pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi rtag pa nyid kho na la yod par nges par phyin ci log tu grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are established as contradictory.

original: 'di gnyis grub kyang ci'i phyir 'di gnyis 'gal ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di gnyis grub kyang ci'i phyir 'di gnyis 'gal ba yin zhe na /
translated: Why are these two contradictory, even though they are established?

original: smras pa / de nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba rtag pa nyid las phyin ci log mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bas na bsgrub par bya ba phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa'i phyir 'gal ba dag yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / de nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba rtag pa nyid las phyin ci log mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir ro // de bas na bsgrub par bya ba phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa'i phyir 'gal ba dag yin no //
translated: Objection: That is to be proven, because impermanence is the opposite of permanence.🔽Therefore, because they prove the opposite of what is to be proven, they are contradictory.

original: ci ste bsgrub par bya ba phyin ci log tu sgrub pa'i phyir 'di dag nyid 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: ci ste bsgrub par bya ba phyin ci log tu sgrub pa'i phyir 'di dag nyid 'gal ba yin no //
translated: But if they prove the opposite of what is to be proven, then they are contradictory.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la ni smras pa bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la ni smras pa bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: In inference for the sake of others, the thesis is stated,

original: ma smras pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: ma smras pa ni ma yin la /
translated: but not the reason.

original: 'god pa ni ma smras pa yin no //
analyzed: 'god pa ni ma smras pa yin no //
translated: The statement of the reason is not stated.

original: de bas na 'dod pa la gnod pa byed pa 'di gnyis las gzhan yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de bas na 'dod pa la gnod pa byed pa 'di gnyis las gzhan yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that these two are different from the two that undermine what is accepted, it is said:

original: 'dod pa sgras ma smos pa la gnod par byed pa phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa'i phyir @79b 'gal ba gsum pa yang yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'dod pa sgras ma smos pa la gnod par byed pa phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa'i phyir @79b 'gal ba gsum pa yang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t there a third type of contradiction that undermines what is not stated by the opponent through proving the opposite of what is accepted?

original: gnyis ni smras pa phyin ci log tu sgrub pa yin la /
analyzed: gnyis ni smras pa phyin ci log tu sgrub pa yin la /
translated: The other two are the proof of the opposite of what is stated.

original: 'di ni gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gsum pa yin no //
translated: This is the third.

original: 'dod pa la gnod pa'i dpe brjod pa ni dper na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la gnod pa'i dpe brjod pa ni dper na zhes bya'o //
translated: The example of the harm of desire is stated: for example, it is like the harm of desire.

original: mig la sogs pa ni chos can no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni chos can no //
translated: The eye, etc. are the subject.

original: gzhan gyi don ni dgos pa po la legs par nye bar byed pa gang yin pa ni gzhan gyi don te bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don ni dgos pa po la legs par nye bar byed pa gang yin pa ni gzhan gyi don te bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The benefit of others is the purpose. That which is well applied to the beneficiary is the benefit of others, which is to be accomplished.

original: 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of being a collection.

original: bsags pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: bsags pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs te /
translated: Because of being an accumulation, this is the reason.

original: mig la sogs pa ni rdul phra rab bsags pa'i ngo bo yin pa de bas na 'dus pa'i ngo bo zhes smos so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni rdul phra rab bsags pa'i ngo bo yin pa de bas na 'dus pa'i ngo bo zhes smos so //
translated: The eye, etc. are the essence of an accumulation of subtle particles. Therefore, it is said to be the essence of a collection.

original: mal cha dang stan la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de mal cha dang stan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mal cha dang stan la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de mal cha dang stan la sogs pa'o //
translated: Beds, seats, etc. are the bed, seat, etc.

original: de dag nyid yan lag ste skyes bu'i longs spyod kyi yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag nyid yan lag ste skyes bu'i longs spyod kyi yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those very things are the limbs, because they are the limbs of a person's enjoyment.

original: 'di ni khyab pa'i yul bstan pa'i dpe yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni khyab pa'i yul bstan pa'i dpe yin no //
translated: This is an example of teaching the pervasion.

original: 'dir ni gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid ces bya ba la khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid ces bya ba la khyab pa yin te /
translated: Here, the pervasion is by the phrase the very activity for the benefit of others.

original: 'di ltar mal cha dang stan la sogs pa 'dus pa'i ngo bo yin pa ni skyes bu'i longs spyod pa yin zhing phan par byed pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mal cha dang stan la sogs pa 'dus pa'i ngo bo yin pa ni skyes bu'i longs spyod pa yin zhing phan par byed pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Thus, bedding, seats, and so on are the essence of a collection, and since they are enjoyed by a person and are beneficial, they are called “the performance of the aims of others.”

original: ji ltar 'di 'dod pa la gnod par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di 'dod pa la gnod par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is this a harm to desire?

original: de ni 'dus pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni 'dus pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not a collection.

original: gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid du 'dod de /
translated: It is asserted to be the performance of the aims of others.

original: phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa'i phyir 'gal ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa'i phyir 'gal ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is contradictory because it is accomplished in a perverse way.

original: 'dod pa ma yin pa'i yul can gzhan gyi don ni 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid du 'dod pa yin pas 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid du 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ma yin pa'i yul can gzhan gyi don ni 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid du 'dod pa yin pas 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid du 'dod pa'o //
translated: The performance of the aims of others that has an object that is not desired is not a collection. It is asserted to be the performance of the aims of others that is not a collection.

original: rgol ba grangs can de ni 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid du 'dod pa'o /
analyzed: rgol ba grangs can de ni 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid du 'dod pa'o /
translated: The Sāṃkhya opponent asserts that it is the performance of the aims of others that is not a collection.

original: de phyin ci log pa ni 'dus pa gzhan gyi don byed ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de phyin ci log pa ni 'dus pa gzhan gyi don byed ces bya ba yin te /
translated: That is perverse, because it is said to be the performance of the aims of others that is a collection.

original: de bsgrub pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de bsgrub pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin no //
translated: and that is contradictory.

original: grangs can dag bdag yod do zhes smra ba na sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: grangs can dag bdag yod do zhes smra ba na sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis /
translated: When the Sāṃkhyas say, “The self exists,” the Buddhists ask,

original: de ci'i phyir zhes dris pa dang / bdag grub par bya ba'i phyir tshad ma smra ba yin te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhes dris pa dang / bdag grub par bya ba'i phyir tshad ma smra ba yin te /
translated: “Why?” and they say, “We assert valid knowledge in order to establish the self.

original: de bas na mig la sogs pa ni 'dus pa ma yin pa'i bdag la phan par byed pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mig la sogs pa ni 'dus pa ma yin pa'i bdag la phan par byed pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the eye and so on are established as that which benefits the noncomposite self.”

original: gtan tshigs 'di ni phyin ci log gis khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ni phyin ci log gis khyab pa yin te /
translated: This reason is pervaded by the opposite.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig gang la phan par byed pa de ni skyed par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig gang la phan par byed pa de ni skyed par byed pa yin la /
translated: Thus whatever benefits something is its producer.

original: bskyed par bya ba yang cig char ram rim gyis 'dus par 'gyur te /🔽de @80a * //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba yang cig char ram rim gyis 'dus par 'gyur te / de @80a * //
translated: And what is produced is either simultaneous or sequential.

original: pas mig la sogs pa gzhan gyi don byed pa ni 'dus pa gzhan gyi don byed do zhes par 'grub bo //
analyzed: pas mig la sogs pa gzhan gyi don byed pa ni 'dus pa gzhan gyi don byed do zhes par 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore it is established that the eye and so on, which benefit others, are composites that benefit others.

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos 'gal ba 'di yang bstan na /
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos 'gal ba 'di yang bstan na /
translated: Master Dignāga also taught this contradiction.

original: rnam 'grel byed pa khyod bzhin du //
analyzed: rnam 'grel byed pa khyod bzhin du //
translated: You who compose the commentary

original: de ci'i phyir ma smos she na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir ma smos she na /
translated: Why is this not mentioned?

original: cig shos kyis smras pa /
analyzed: cig shos kyis smras pa /
translated: The other says:

original: bsgrub par bya ba phyin ci log tu sgrub par byed pa 'di gnyis kho na'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba phyin ci log tu sgrub par byed pa 'di gnyis kho na'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because these two are included in the two fallacious proofs.

original: smras pa'i phyin ci log sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin na ci ltar smras pa'i phyin ci log sgrub par byed pa gnyis kyi nang du 'dus she na /
analyzed: smras pa'i phyin ci log sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin na ci ltar smras pa'i phyin ci log sgrub par byed pa gnyis kyi nang du 'dus she na /
translated: If it is not a fallacious proof, how is it included in the two fallacious proofs?

original: de ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “That is not so,”🔽because it is not so.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The word “because” means “for what reason.”

original: gang gi phyir 'dod pa la gnod pa de bsgrub par bya ba'i log par bsgrub pa'i sgo nas gtan tshigs 'di gnyis las tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod pa la gnod pa de bsgrub par bya ba'i log par bsgrub pa'i sgo nas gtan tshigs 'di gnyis las tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not a fault to desire, this reason is not different from the two fallacious proofs.

original: smras pa phyin ci log tu sgrub par byed pa yin yang rung ma yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: smras pa phyin ci log tu sgrub par byed pa yin yang rung ma yin yang rung ste /
translated: He says, “Whether it is a fallacious proof or not,

original: ji ltar de gnyis bsgrub par bya ba phyin ci log tu sgrub par byed pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin pas de bas na smras pa phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa ci zhig bya /
analyzed: ji ltar de gnyis bsgrub par bya ba phyin ci log tu sgrub par byed pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin pas de bas na smras pa phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa ci zhig bya /
translated: Just as these two are established in a way that is contrary to the way they are to be established, so it is here as well. Therefore, why do you say that they are established in a way that is contrary to the way they are to be established?

original: de bas na 'di gnyis kyi nang kho nar 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di gnyis kyi nang kho nar 'dug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are included only within these two.

original: smras pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: smras pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: Objection: Aren’t they to be established?

original: de ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba phyin ci log bsgrub pa'i sgo nas tha dad pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba phyin ci log bsgrub pa'i sgo nas tha dad pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How can they be established in a way that is contrary to the way they are to be established?

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: Response: “Desire and speech” are mentioned.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: 'dod pa dang smras pa gnyis la bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi sgo nas phan tshun bye brag tha dad pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang smras pa gnyis la bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi sgo nas phan tshun bye brag tha dad pa ci yang med do //
translated: there is no difference between desire and speech in terms of being the object to be established.

original: de bas na 'di gnyis kho nar 'dus pa yin no zhes bya bar mjug bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di gnyis kho nar 'dus pa yin no zhes bya bar mjug bsdus pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are included only within these two. This is the conclusion.

original: 'di ltar phyir rgol bas shes par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni skabs su bab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyir rgol bas shes par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni skabs su bab pa yin no //
translated: Thus, whatever the opponent wishes to know is relevant here.

original: skabs su bab pa yin pa de yang 'dod pa smra ba yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa yin pa de yang 'dod pa smra ba yin yang rung ste /
translated: And this is the case, whether one is a proponent of desire or not.

original: sgrub par 'dod pas yul du bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sgrub par 'dod pas yul du bya ba yin gyi /
translated: One who wishes to establish this should take it as the object of his inquiry.

original: smra ba tsam 'ba' zhig ni ma yin pa de bas bye brag med do //
analyzed: smra ba tsam 'ba' zhig ni ma yin pa de bas bye brag med do //
translated: But it is not merely the mere statement. Therefore, there is no difference.

original: tshul gnyi ga ma grub na 'gal ba yin par bshad zin to //
analyzed: tshul gnyi ga ma grub na 'gal ba yin par bshad zin to //
translated: And it has already been explained that when neither of the two is established, there is contradiction.

original: de gnyis kyi nang nas /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi nang nas /
translated: And of those two,

original: gcig ni ma grub pa la cig shos la the tshom za na yang ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig ni ma grub pa la cig shos la the tshom za na yang ma nges pa yin no //
translated: if one is not established, and there is doubt about the other, then there is uncertainty.

original: de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba gcig dang / thams cad mkhyen pa yin no zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba gcig dang / thams cad mkhyen pa yin no zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa'o //
translated: “He who is free from attachment is free from attachment” is the first probandum, and “he is omniscient” is the second probandum.

original: smra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: smra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: “Because he speaks” is the reason.

original: 'di la ldog @80b pa ni ma grub pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di la ldog @80b pa ni ma grub pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Here, the nonestablishment of the counter-pervasion is called “nonestablishment of the reason.”

original: bdag nyid 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ni smra ba nyid mthong bas na ldog pa ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ni smra ba nyid mthong bas na ldog pa ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Since it is seen that one who is not omniscient and who is not free from attachment does speak, the reason is not established as being a property of the subject.

original: ci'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba la the tshom za ba yin zhe na /🔽phyogs dang mthun par 'gyur ba thams cad mkhyen pa dang ; 'dod chags dang bral ba dag ni bskal pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba la the tshom za ba yin zhe na / phyogs dang mthun par 'gyur ba thams cad mkhyen pa dang ; 'dod chags dang bral ba dag ni bskal pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Why is there doubt about the pervasion?🔽He says, “Because all that is similar to the property of the subject is beyond the senses.”

original: dbang po'i yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Omniscience and freedom from attachment are beyond the senses.

original: tshig la sogs pa dag ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba yin yang /
analyzed: tshig la sogs pa dag ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba yin yang /
translated: Although words and so on are known by the sense consciousnesses,

original: dbang po'i yul las 'das pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba gnyis la yod dam med the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i yul las 'das pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba gnyis la yod dam med the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: there is doubt as to whether or not omniscience and freedom from attachment exist, since they are beyond the senses.

original: de bas ni smra ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa yin nam /
analyzed: de bas ni smra ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa yin nam /
translated: Therefore, is one omniscient because one speaks?

original: 'on te ma yin zhes bya bar mngon pa med pas ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhes bya bar mngon pa med pas ma nges pa yin no //
translated: But if it is not so, then it is not ascertained.

original: da ni gnyis nyid la the tshom za na ma nges par brjod pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: da ni gnyis nyid la the tshom za na ma nges par brjod pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Now, if one doubts whether it is both, it is said to be uncertain because it is the cause of doubt.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i tshul de nyid la the tshom za ba'i phyir yid gnyis kyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i tshul de nyid la the tshom za ba'i phyir yid gnyis kyi rgyu yin no //
translated: It is the cause of doubt because one doubts the mode of concomitance and reverse concomitance.

original: dpe dgod de bdag dang bcas par 'dug pa ni bdag dang bcas par 'dus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dpe dgod de bdag dang bcas par 'dug pa ni bdag dang bcas par 'dus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: The example is stated: “That which is endowed with a self is endowed with a self and is aggregated.” This is the probandum.

original: lus zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
analyzed: lus zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
translated: The body is the subject.

original: gson po'i zhes bya ba ni chos can gyi bye brag ste /
analyzed: gson po'i zhes bya ba ni chos can gyi bye brag ste /
translated: The living is a distinction of the subject.

original: shi ba la bdag yod par mi 'dod do ;
analyzed: shi ba la bdag yod par mi 'dod do ;
translated: For a dead body, the existence of a self is not accepted.

original: / srog ni dbugs rgyu ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / srog ni dbugs rgyu ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Life is the movement of the breath, and so on.

original: sogs pa ni mig 'byed pa dang / 'dzums pa la sogs pa srog chags kyi chos de ni srog la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa ni mig 'byed pa dang / 'dzums pa la sogs pa srog chags kyi chos de ni srog la sogs pa'o //
translated: The “and so on” includes the opening and closing of the eyes, and so on. The qualities of living beings are life and so on.

original: de dag gang la yod pa de ni srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa gson po'i lus so //
analyzed: de dag gang la yod pa de ni srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa gson po'i lus so //
translated: That which possesses them is the living body endowed with life and so on.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de de bas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de de bas zhes bya ste /
translated: Its entity is just that, and so it is said, “because of that.”

original: 'di gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'di gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is the reason.

original: thun mong ma yin pa 'di yang the tshom za ba'i rgyu nyid du bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa 'di yang the tshom za ba'i rgyu nyid du bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: This uncommon reason should be established as the cause of doubt.

original: phyogs kyi chos ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis the tshom gyi rgyur gyur pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis the tshom gyi rgyur gyur pa nyid yin te /
translated: The property of the subject is the cause of doubt in two ways.

original: the tshom gyi rnam pa gang yin pa de dag gnyis kyi dngos po thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir dang / khyab par byed pa'i rnam pa de gnyis las yang yod par ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom gyi rnam pa gang yin pa de dag gnyis kyi dngos po thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir dang / khyab par byed pa'i rnam pa de gnyis las yang yod par ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all entities are included in the two aspects of doubt, and because of the non-ascertainment of existence from those two aspects that pervade.

original: rnam pa gang dag gis dngos po thams cad ma bsdus pa'i rnam pa de dag la ni the tshom du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa gang dag gis dngos po thams cad ma bsdus pa'i rnam pa de dag la ni the tshom du mi 'gyur te /
translated: With respect to aspects that do not include all entities, there is no doubt.

original: 'di rnam pa gzhan srid na ni phyogs kyi chos can de chos gnyis las gcig dang 'brel bar bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'di rnam pa gzhan srid na ni phyogs kyi chos can de chos gnyis las gcig dang 'brel bar bstan par mi nus te /
translated: If there were other aspects, it would not be possible to indicate that the subject of the property has a relation with one of the two properties.

original: de bas na the tshom gyi rgyur mi @81a * //
analyzed: de bas na the tshom gyi rgyur mi @81a * //
translated: Therefore, it is not the cause of doubt.

original: 'gyur ro // chos gnyis ma nges par yod par ston na ni the tshom gyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // chos gnyis ma nges par yod par ston na ni the tshom gyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were to teach the existence of two undetermined things, it would be the cause of doubt.

original: gnyis ma nges par yod par yang bstan par mi nus na ni mi rtog pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis ma nges par yod par yang bstan par mi nus na ni mi rtog pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not able to teach the existence of two undetermined things, it would be the cause of non-understanding.

original: nges par yong par bstan na ni 'gal ba'am gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par yong par bstan na ni 'gal ba'am gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were to teach the existence of two determined things, it would be contradictory or a reason.

original: de bas na gnyis kyi dngos po thams cad bsdus pa yin la /🔽ci ste de gnyis la gcig pa yang yod par nges pa ma yin na ni de nyid la the tshom za ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gnyis kyi dngos po thams cad bsdus pa yin la / ci ste de gnyis la gcig pa yang yod par nges pa ma yin na ni de nyid la the tshom za ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, all things are included in the two.🔽If it were not certain that those two exist as one, then it would be the cause of doubt about that very thing.

original: yod par nges par yang 'gal te gcig la mi 'khrul par yod par nges na ni 'gal ba'am gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod par nges par yang 'gal te gcig la mi 'khrul par yod par nges na ni 'gal ba'am gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were certain that they exist, it would be contradictory, because if it were certain that they exist without confusion in one, it would be contradictory or a reason.

original: mi 'khrul pa ma yin par yod par nges pa yin na ni thun mong gis ma nges pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba dang / ldog pa ma grub la rjes su 'gro ba la the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'khrul pa ma yin par yod par nges pa yin na ni thun mong gis ma nges pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba dang / ldog pa ma grub la rjes su 'gro ba la the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is ascertained that it exists without being non-erroneous, then it is not ascertained by the common person, and there is doubt about the reversal from the discordant class, and there is doubt about the reversal that is not established and the forward pervasion.

original: gcig la yang yod par nges pa med pa'i phyir ni thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig la yang yod par nges pa med pa'i phyir ni thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And because there is no ascertainment of existence in one, there is an uncommon non-ascertainment.

original: de bas na thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa nyid kyi rgyu rnam pa gnyis bstan pa'i phyir bdag dang bcas pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bas na thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa nyid kyi rgyu rnam pa gnyis bstan pa'i phyir bdag dang bcas pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach the two types of causes of uncommon non-ascertainment, he says, “with self” and so on.

original: bdag dang lhan cig tu 'dug pa ni bdag dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang lhan cig tu 'dug pa ni bdag dang bcas pa'o //
translated: That which is present with self is with self.

original: gang la 'brel pa de ni bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: gang la 'brel pa de ni bdag med pa ste /
translated: That which is related to that is selfless.

original: gang gi phyir de dag las phung po gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag las phung po gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because there is no other aggregate than those.

original: ji lta bu zhig ce na gang la dngos po'i chos srog la sogs pa 'di gnas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig ce na gang la dngos po'i chos srog la sogs pa 'di gnas par gyur pa'o //
translated: What is it like? It is that in which this property of an entity, life, and so on, is present.

original: de bas 'di de gnyis la the tshom za ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de bas 'di de gnyis la the tshom za ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the cause of doubt about those two.

original: ci'i phyir phung po gzhan med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phung po gzhan med ce na /
translated: Why is there no other aggregate?

original: smras pa / bdag smras pa la ni dngos po yod pa dang / rnam par gcad pa ni dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / bdag smras pa la ni dngos po yod pa dang / rnam par gcad pa ni dngos po med pa ste /
translated: It is said: In the statement of self, there is existence, and in the statement of no self, there is non-existence.

original: de gnyis kyis dngos po thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir de'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis dngos po thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir de'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those two include all things, they are included within them.

original: gang la bdag yod pa de ni bdag dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: gang la bdag yod pa de ni bdag dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: That which has a self is with self,

original: gzhan ni bdag med pa de'i phyir phung po gzhan med do //
analyzed: gzhan ni bdag med pa de'i phyir phung po gzhan med do //
translated: and the other is without self. Therefore, there is no other aggregate.

original: the tshom gyi rgyu nyid du gyur ba'i rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis dngos po thams cad bsdus pa bstan nas /
analyzed: the tshom gyi rgyu nyid du gyur ba'i rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis dngos po thams cad bsdus pa bstan nas /
translated: Having shown that all things are included by the two causes that become the cause of doubt,

original: gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to show the second,

original: 'di gnyis las zhes bya ba smos te /🔽bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis kyi nang nas bdag dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: 'di gnyis las zhes bya ba smos te / bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis kyi nang nas bdag dang bcas pa'am /
translated: he says, “From these two,”🔽and so on.

original: bdag med par cig la yang gnas shing yod par nges pa med do //
analyzed: bdag med par cig la yang gnas shing yod par nges pa med do //
translated: From within the two kinds, with self and without self, there is no certainty that it exists, abiding in either with self or without self.

original: srog la sogs pa ni dngos po chos yin pa'i phyir phung po gnyis las ma @81b gtogs par gnas pa med do //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa ni dngos po chos yin pa'i phyir phung po gnyis las ma @81b gtogs par gnas pa med do //
translated: Life and so on are not established as existing apart from the two categories of form and mind, because they are properties of things.

original: de bas na 'di nyid kho na la gnas so zhes bya ba de tsam du ni shes na /
analyzed: de bas na 'di nyid kho na la gnas so zhes bya ba de tsam du ni shes na /
translated: Therefore, if one understands that they exist only in this way,

original: bye brag tu 'dug par nges pa ni med do zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin no //
analyzed: bye brag tu 'dug par nges pa ni med do zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin no //
translated: then the meaning is that there is no certainty that they exist separately.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:

original: bdag dang bcas pa nyid kyi bye brag dang ldan bar sgrub ba la dngos po nges pa la ni srog la sogs pa'i chos ma grub ste /
analyzed: bdag dang bcas pa nyid kyi bye brag dang ldan bar sgrub ba la dngos po nges pa la ni srog la sogs pa'i chos ma grub ste /
translated: In establishing that they possess the distinction of having a self, the properties of life and so on are not established as definite entities,

original: ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not certain.

original: de ltar chos thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa'i rgyu rnam pa gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar chos thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa'i rgyu rnam pa gnyis bstan to //
translated: Thus, two types of causes for the uncertainty of uncommon properties have been demonstrated.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phyogs kyi chos yin bar gyur pa thams cad thun mong dam thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pra 'gyur ba de bas na mjug bsdu ba'i thabs kyis phyogs kyi chos kho na ston par byed de /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phyogs kyi chos yin bar gyur pa thams cad thun mong dam thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pra 'gyur ba de bas na mjug bsdu ba'i thabs kyis phyogs kyi chos kho na ston par byed de /
translated: “Therefore, etc.” shows that all the properties of the position are either uncertain in general or uncertain in particular. Therefore, by the method of conclusion, he shows only the property of the position.

original: gson po'i lus dang 'brel pa can gyi phyogs kyi chos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gson po'i lus dang 'brel pa can gyi phyogs kyi chos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “the property of the position which is related to the living body” is as follows.

original: 'di ltar de gnyis las gcig la yang gnas par nges pa med ba de bas na /
analyzed: 'di ltar de gnyis las gcig la yang gnas par nges pa med ba de bas na /
translated: Thus, since it is not certain that either of the two is present,

original: de gnyis dang bral ba med de /
analyzed: de gnyis dang bral ba med de /
translated: it is not absent from both.

original: 'di ltar dngos po thams cad la khyab bar byed pa'i dngos po'i chos rnam pa gnyis las gcig la nges par yod pa yin na ni rnam pa gzhan las des par log pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po thams cad la khyab bar byed pa'i dngos po'i chos rnam pa gnyis las gcig la nges par yod pa yin na ni rnam pa gzhan las des par log pa yin no //
translated: Thus, if one of the two properties of entities which pervade all entities is definitely present, then it is definitely absent from the other.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bdag dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa thams cad kyi dngos po las log pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bdag dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa thams cad kyi dngos po las log pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “because it is not established that it is absent from all entities which have a self or are without a self.”

original: re zhig srog la sogs pa ni bum pa la sogs pa kha cig las ni log pa kho na yin no //🔽de bas na bdag dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: re zhig srog la sogs pa ni bum pa la sogs pa kha cig las ni log pa kho na yin no // de bas na bdag dang bcas pa'am /
translated: For a while, life, etc. are only reversed from some, such as a pot.

original: bdag med pa 'ga' zhig las log pa yin na zhes bya ba ni de tsam du ni ngas par bya nus na /
analyzed: bdag med pa 'ga' zhig las log pa yin na zhes bya ba ni de tsam du ni ngas par bya nus na /
translated: Therefore, it is possible to reverse from something with a self or from something without a self.

original: thams cad las log pa yin par ni nges par mi nus so //
analyzed: thams cad las log pa yin par ni nges par mi nus so //
translated: But it is not possible to ascertain that they are reversed from everything.

original: de bas na gang las kyang log pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na gang las kyang log pa med do //
translated: Therefore, they are not reversed from anything at all.

original: ci ste de lta na de gnyis la rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yin mod ce na /
analyzed: ci ste de lta na de gnyis la rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yin mod ce na /
translated: If you say, “In that case, it is ascertained that they are concomitant with those two,”

original: de la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, “In that case, . . .”

original: bdag dang bcas pa'am bdag med pa'i don la srog la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: bdag dang bcas pa'am bdag med pa'i don la srog la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba med do //
translated: Life, etc. are not concomitant with the meaning of something with a self or without a self.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag gcig la yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bdag gcig la yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “Even in one self . . .”

original: bdag dang bcas pa'am bdag la med pa la ma grub pa'i rgyu'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag dang bcas pa'am bdag la med pa la ma grub pa'i rgyu'i phyir te /
translated: Because the reason is not established for something with a self or for something without a self.

original: srog la sogs pa dngos po'i chos yin pas de nyid las 'ga' zhig la 'jug pa yin no zhes bya bar ni nges na /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dngos po'i chos yin pas de nyid las 'ga' zhig la 'jug pa yin no zhes bya bar ni nges na /
translated: Life force and so on are things that are entities, and therefore it is ascertained that they engage some object.🔽But it is not ascertained that they engage only the selflessness of persons.

original: bdag med pa kho na la 'jug par ni nges pa med pas ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yod /🔽phyir rgol ba la ni bdag dang @82a * //🔽bcas pa 'ga' yang med pa yin pas de bas na gtan tshigs 'di'i bdag dang bcas pa la rjes su 'gro ba yang med ldog pa yang med pas bdag dang bcas pa la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis med par nges pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bdag med pa kho na la 'jug par ni nges pa med pas ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yod / phyir rgol ba la ni bdag dang @82a * // bcas pa 'ga' yang med pa yin pas de bas na gtan tshigs 'di'i bdag dang bcas pa la rjes su 'gro ba yang med ldog pa yang med pas bdag dang bcas pa la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis med par nges pa ma yin nam /
translated: Therefore how can there be a definite pervasion?🔽Since there is no opponent who has a self, therefore this reason does not have a definite pervasion or a definite contrapositive with respect to that which has a self.

original: de yod par the tshom za ba ma yin no snyam du dogs pa la /
analyzed: de yod par the tshom za ba ma yin no snyam du dogs pa la /
translated: So how can it be ascertained that it does not have a definite pervasion and contrapositive with respect to that which has a self?

original: bdag dang bcas pa'i dngos bo las srog la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis med par nges pa med la /🔽bdag med pa la yang med do //
analyzed: bdag dang bcas pa'i dngos bo las srog la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis med par nges pa med la /🔽bdag med pa la yang med do //
translated: Since it is not ascertained that life force and so on do not have a definite pervasion and contrapositive with respect to things that have a self,🔽it is not ascertained that they do not have a definite pervasion and contrapositive with respect to the selflessness of persons.

original: bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa las zhes bya ba'i snga ma'i sgra la ltos par blta'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa las zhes bya ba'i snga ma'i sgra la ltos par blta'o //
translated: The words “with self” and “without self” should be seen as referring to the former.

original: ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis med par nges pa med ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis med par nges pa med ce na /
translated: How is it that without both concomitance and the reverse of concomitance, there is no ascertainment?

original: smras pa / rjes su 'gro ba'am ldog pa gang yin pa gcig med par nges pa ni cig shos gnyis pa yod bar gdon mi za bar med na /
analyzed: smras pa / rjes su 'gro ba'am ldog pa gang yin pa gcig med par nges pa ni cig shos gnyis pa yod bar gdon mi za bar med na /
translated: We reply: If one of the two, concomitance or the reverse of concomitance, is ascertained as absent, then the other, the second, is necessarily absent.

original: med pa yin te /
analyzed: med pa yin te /
translated: It is absent.

original: ci'i phyir yod par nges pa mi 'khrul ba yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir yod par nges pa mi 'khrul ba yin no //
translated: Why? Because the ascertainment of existence is nonerroneous.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de de bas na'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de de bas na'o //
translated: Its nature is just that, and therefore it is so.

original: gang gi phyir gcig med par nges pa ni cig shos yod pa med na med pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gcig med par nges pa ni cig shos yod pa med na med pa yin te /
translated: Because the ascertainment of the absence of one is the ascertainment of the presence of the other,

original: de bas na gcig la gnyi ga med par nges pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na gcig la gnyi ga med par nges pa med do //
translated: therefore there is no ascertainment of the absence of both in one.

original: ci'i phyir gcig med par nges pa ni cig shos yod par nges pa mi 'khrul pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gcig med par nges pa ni cig shos yod par nges pa mi 'khrul pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the ascertainment of the absence of one the nonerroneous ascertainment of the presence of the other?

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis ni phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis ni phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The two, concomitance and the absence of, are the nature of mutual exclusion.

original: phan tshun rnam par gcod pa ni dngos po med pa'o //🔽de nyid ngo bo gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: phan tshun rnam par gcod pa ni dngos po med pa'o // de nyid ngo bo gang yin pa ste /
translated: Mutual exclusion is the absence of entity.🔽That itself is the nature.

original: de nyid kyi ngo bo ni de nyid de de bas na'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi ngo bo ni de nyid de de bas na'o //
translated: That itself is the nature of that, and that is why.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis ni yod pa dang med pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis ni yod pa dang med pa yin no //
translated: The two, concomitance and the absence of, are existence and nonexistence.

original: yod pa dang med pa gnyis ni phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa gnyis ni phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: The two, existence and nonexistence, are the nature of mutual exclusion.🔽That which is excluded by the absence of something is the existence of that.

original: gang rnam par bcad pas gang yongs su gcod pa de ni yongs su spangs te gnas pa yin la rang med pa rnam par gcod pas kyang yod pa yongs su gcod do //
analyzed: gang rnam par bcad pas gang yongs su gcod pa de ni yongs su spangs te gnas pa yin la rang med pa rnam par gcod pas kyang yod pa yongs su gcod do //
translated: That which is excluded by the absence of itself is also the existence of itself.

original: de bas na rang med par rnam par bcad pas yod par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rang med par rnam par bcad pas yod par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the existence of something is excluded by the absence of itself.

original: med pa ni rnam par rtog pas ji ltar bstan pa'i ngo bo med pa yin la /
analyzed: med pa ni rnam par rtog pas ji ltar bstan pa'i ngo bo med pa yin la /
translated: Nonexistence is the absence of the entity that is indicated by the thought.

original: ngo bo yang rnam par bcad pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo yang rnam par bcad pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: The nature of the negation is also a negation,
