original: bdag dang bdag med pa bzhin du yongs su gcod par byed do //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag med pa bzhin du yongs su gcod par byed do //
translated: just as the self and selflessness are both determinations.

original: de lta yin dang rjes su 'gro ba med pa ni ldog pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta yin dang rjes su 'gro ba med pa ni ldog pa yin la /
translated: If that were not so, then the absence of concomitance would be the absence of the counter-positive,

original: ldog ba med pa ni rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: ldog ba med pa ni rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
translated: and the absence of the counter-positive would be the absence of concomitance.

original: de bas na rjes su 'gro ba @82b med par nges pa na yang ldog pa yod par nges pa yin la /
analyzed: de bas na rjes su 'gro ba @82b med par nges pa na yang ldog pa yod par nges pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, when one ascertains the absence of concomitance, one also ascertains the absence of the counter-positive,

original: ldog pa med bar nges pa na yang rjes su 'gro ba yod par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa med bar nges pa na yang rjes su 'gro ba yod par nges pa yin no //
translated: and when one ascertains the absence of the counter-positive, one also ascertains the absence of concomitance.

original: de bas na gal te bdag dang bcas pa ni dngos po med la /
analyzed: de bas na gal te bdag dang bcas pa ni dngos po med la /
translated: Therefore, even if things that have a self do not exist,

original: bdag med pa ni dngos po yin ba de lta na yang de nyid grog la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis med par nges pa med de /
analyzed: bdag med pa ni dngos po yin ba de lta na yang de nyid grog la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis med par nges pa med de /
translated: and things that are selfless do exist, still, in that case, it is not the case that one cannot ascertain the absence of both concomitance and the counter-positive.

original: dngos po gcig la dus gcig tu yod ba dang med pa gnyis cig car 'gal ba'i phyir de gnyis ka med par nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po gcig la dus gcig tu yod ba dang med pa gnyis cig car 'gal ba'i phyir de gnyis ka med par nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is contradictory for one thing to exist and not exist at the same time, and therefore it is not possible to ascertain the absence of both.

original: phyir rgol ba'i dor byas te /
analyzed: phyir rgol ba'i dor byas te /
translated: rejection of that.🔽Nor is there any question of the existence or nonexistence of things with

original: bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa'i dngos po yod med du bya ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa'i dngos po yod med du bya ba yang ma yin no //
translated: and without self.

original: 'o na ci zhe na tshad ma'i dbang gis te /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na tshad ma'i dbang gis te /
translated: But what is the case? It is a matter of the power of valid cognition.

original: des na gnyi ga la the tshom za'o //
analyzed: des na gnyi ga la the tshom za'o //
translated: Therefore, one is uncertain about both.🔽Therefore, one is uncertain about the existence or nonexistence of the

original: de bas na de gnyis la srog la sogs pa'i ldog pa yod med du the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de gnyis la srog la sogs pa'i ldog pa yod med du the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: reversal of life, etc., in both cases.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar 'ga' zhig la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis yod par nges pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar 'ga' zhig la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis yod par nges pa yang ma yin /
translated: Since in this way one is not certain that the two—the positive and negative concomitances—exist for some,🔽and one is not certain that they do not exist, therefore one is uncertain about

original: med bar nges pa yang ma yin pa de bas na rjes su 'gro ba ldog pa gnyis la the tshom za'o //
analyzed: med bar nges pa yang ma yin pa de bas na rjes su 'gro ba ldog pa gnyis la the tshom za'o //
translated: the positive and negative concomitances.🔽If one were certain that one of the positive and negative concomitances did🔽not exist for some, then one would be certain that the other existed. Therefore,

original: ci ste 'ga' zhig la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gcig med par nges pa yin na ni de nyid kyis gnyis yod par nges pa yin pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la the tshom za ba kho nar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste 'ga' zhig la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gcig med par nges pa yin na ni de nyid kyis gnyis yod par nges pa yin pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la the tshom za ba kho nar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: one would not be uncertain about the positive and negative concomitances.

original: gang gi phyir 'ga' la yang yod pa dang med par nges pa med pa de nyid kyi phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis la the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'ga' la yang yod pa dang med par nges pa med pa de nyid kyi phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis la the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: Because there is no certainty that anything exists or does not exist, there is doubt about the presence or absence of the reason in similar and dissimilar instances.

original: the tshom za bas ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: the tshom za bas ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Because there is doubt, the reason is inconclusive.

original: ci'i phyir ma nges pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma nges pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it inconclusive?

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang cig shos 'gal ba la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la de ltar the tshom za bas nges pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang cig shos 'gal ba la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la de ltar the tshom za bas nges pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is doubt about the presence or absence of the probandum and its opposite in similar and dissimilar instances, there is no certainty.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis la yod med the tshom za na bsgrub par bya ba mi 'grub pa la 'gal ba yang mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis la yod med the tshom za na bsgrub par bya ba mi 'grub pa la 'gal ba yang mi 'grub bo //
translated: If there is doubt about the presence or absence of the probandum and its opposite in both the similar and dissimilar instances, then the probandum is not established, and the contradiction is also not established.

original: bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa las rnam pa gzhan yang mi srid pa de bas na srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir gson po'i lus chos can la bdag yod med the tshom za ba'i srog la sogs pa ma nges pa yin no
analyzed: bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa las rnam pa gzhan yang mi srid pa de bas na srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir gson po'i lus chos can la bdag yod med the tshom za ba'i srog la sogs pa ma nges pa yin no
translated: Since it is impossible for there to be any other aspect besides the aspects of self and selflessness, the existence or nonexistence of a self in the living body, which possesses life and so on, is uncertain, because there is doubt about the existence or nonexistence of a self.

original: // tshul gsum pa ma grub pa dang the tshom za ba gtan tshigs kyi nyes par bstan nam /
analyzed: // tshul gsum pa ma grub pa dang the tshom za ba gtan tshigs kyi nyes par bstan nam /
translated: Or is it taught that the non-establishment and doubt of the trimodal conditions are faults of the reason?

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir smras pa /🔽de ltar na bstan ma thag pa'i rim pas na tshul gsum po dag gi nang nas gang gi tshe tshul re re na @83a * //🔽grub pa'am the tshom za bar gyur pa dang / tshul gnyis gnyis ma grub pa'am /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir smras pa / de ltar na bstan ma thag pa'i rim pas na tshul gsum po dag gi nang nas gang gi tshe tshul re re na @83a * // grub pa'am the tshom za bar gyur pa dang / tshul gnyis gnyis ma grub pa'am /
translated: In order to summarize, he says:🔽Thus, according to the just explained process, when any one of the three modes is either not established or doubtful, and when any two of the three modes are not established or doubtful, then the reason is, respectively, a contradictory reason, an unestablished reason, or an indefinite reason.

original: the tshom za bar gyur pa de'i tshom grub pa dang / 'gal ba dang / ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba dang / ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni gang ma grub pa dang / the tshom za na gtan tshigs ltar snang ba gang du rigs pa de ni ma grub pa'am the tshom za bar rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: the tshom za bar gyur pa de'i tshom grub pa dang / 'gal ba dang / ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba dang / ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni gang ma grub pa dang / the tshom za na gtan tshigs ltar snang ba gang du rigs pa de ni ma grub pa'am the tshom za bar rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir te /
translated: The phrase “in any appropriate way” means that when the reason is not established or is doubtful, it is a fallacious reason in any appropriate way, because it is posited as either not established or doubtful.

original: gang dang gang la gang gi sbyor ba ni ci ltar rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dang gang la gang gi sbyor ba ni ci ltar rigs pa yin no //
translated: The application of any one of these to any of the three modes is appropriate in any way.

original: slob dpon gyis kyang 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can yang the tshom gyi rgyur bshad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can yang the tshom gyi rgyur bshad pa ma yin nam /
translated: And isn’t it the master himself who explains that a nonerroneous contradiction is a cause of doubt?

original: gtan tshigs kyi 'gal bar sgrub pa gang yin pa de mi 'khrul ba'i 'gal ba ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can no //🔽yang na 'di 'gal ba yang yin te /🔽sgrub par byed pa gzhan gyis grub pa'i chos dang 'gal ba sgrub pa'i phyir dang / mi 'khrul pa can yang yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi 'gal bar sgrub pa gang yin pa de mi 'khrul ba'i 'gal ba ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can no // yang na 'di 'gal ba yang yin te / sgrub par byed pa gzhan gyis grub pa'i chos dang 'gal ba sgrub pa'i phyir dang / mi 'khrul pa can yang yin te /
translated: That which is established as a contradiction of a reason is a nonerroneous contradiction.🔽Or, it is a contradiction because it establishes a property that is established by another proof, and it is nonerroneous because it is nonerroneous with regard to its own probandum.

original: rang gi bsgrub par bya ba 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba'i phyir 'gal ba la mi 'khrul ba can no //
analyzed: rang gi bsgrub par bya ba 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba'i phyir 'gal ba la mi 'khrul ba can no //
translated: It is a nonerroneous contradiction.

original: rang gi bsgrub par bshad pa bden yang ngas 'dir ma smos so //
analyzed: rang gi bsgrub par bshad pa bden yang ngas 'dir ma smos so //
translated: Although it is true that he explains it as a contradiction, I have not mentioned it here.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na smras pa /
translated: Why is that?

original: rjes su dpag ba'i yul ni tshad mas grub pa'i tshul gsum pa las rjes su dpag pa 'byung bde bas na de nyid rjes su dpag pa'i yul na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag ba'i yul ni tshad mas grub pa'i tshul gsum pa las rjes su dpag pa 'byung bde bas na de nyid rjes su dpag pa'i yul na /
translated: Inference arises from a triply characterized object of inference that is established by a valid means of knowledge. Therefore, that itself is the object of inference.

original: skabs de la ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can mi srid do //
analyzed: skabs de la ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can mi srid do //
translated: At that time, there is no possibility of a non-erroneous contradiction.

original: tshad mas ma grub pa'i tshul gsum ba'i gnas skabs la ni gang gi tshul tshad mas grub pa de nyid la gtan tshigs ltar snang ba de ni srid pa yin na /
analyzed: tshad mas ma grub pa'i tshul gsum ba'i gnas skabs la ni gang gi tshul tshad mas grub pa de nyid la gtan tshigs ltar snang ba de ni srid pa yin na /
translated: In the case of the three modes that are not established by a valid cognition, it is possible that whatever mode is established by a valid cognition is a seeming reason.

original: tshad mas grub pa'i tshul gang yin pa la ni tshad mas grub pa'i tshul 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad mas grub pa'i tshul gang yin pa la ni tshad mas grub pa'i tshul 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But in the case of the three modes that are established by a valid cognition, there is no non-erroneous contradiction of the mode that is established by a valid cognition.

original: de bas na mi srid la ;
analyzed: de bas na mi srid la ;
translated: Therefore, it is impossible.

original: mi srid pa de'i phyir ma smos so //
analyzed: mi srid pa de'i phyir ma smos so //
translated: And because it is impossible, it is not mentioned.

original: ci'i phyir mi srid ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi srid ce na /
translated: Why is it impossible?

original: 'bras bu 'am rang bzhin nam mi dmigs pa'i zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'am rang bzhin nam mi dmigs pa'i zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is said, “because of the effect, nature, or non-observation.”

original: gang gi phyir 'gal ba mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gal ba mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because a contradiction is impossible.

original: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin de gnyis kyi mtshan nyid smos pa la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin de gnyis kyi mtshan nyid smos pa la zhes bya ba la /
translated: The characteristics of those two, the effect and nature, are mentioned.

original: 'bras bu ni rgyu las skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rgyu las skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na yin no //
translated: The effect has the characteristic of arising from a cause. That is the reality.

original: rang bzhin yang bsgrub par bya bas khyab ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin yang bsgrub par bya bas khyab ba nyid yin no //
translated: and the nature of the effect is also necessarily the nature of the cause.🔽How can the effect and the nature of the effect be contradictory?

original: 'bras bu gang yin pa dang rang bzhin gang yin pa de gang gis na 'gal bar 'gyur ba ji ltar na bdag gi rgyu dang khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin yongs su 'dor bar gyur na mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid smos @83b pa la yang zhes bya ba
analyzed: 'bras bu gang yin pa dang rang bzhin gang yin pa de gang gis na 'gal bar 'gyur ba ji ltar na bdag gi rgyu dang khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin yongs su 'dor bar gyur na mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid smos @83b pa la yang zhes bya ba
translated: When the cause and the pervader are abandoned, the non-observation of the nature of the pervader is also mentioned.

original: ni snang ba mi dmigs pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: ni snang ba mi dmigs pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: The non-observation of the appearance itself is the characteristic of non-observation.

original: de yang dngos po med par mi 'khrul ba yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba nyid mi srid do //
analyzed: de yang dngos po med par mi 'khrul ba yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba nyid mi srid do //
translated: Moreover, because it is non-erroneous with regard to the non-existence of the thing, it is impossible for there to be a contradiction.

original: 'on te de dag las gzhan las 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te de dag las gzhan las 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that it is from something other than those,

original: gsum po de dag las mi 'khrul pa can gzhan med de zhes bya ba smros te ;
analyzed: gsum po de dag las mi 'khrul pa can gzhan med de zhes bya ba smros te ;
translated: there is no non-erroneous [cognition] other than those three.

original: des bas na de dag nyid rgyu nyid yin no //
analyzed: des bas na de dag nyid rgyu nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, those are the causes.

original: 'o na slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos gtan tshigs kyi skyon 'di gang la gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'o na slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos gtan tshigs kyi skyon 'di gang la gsungs she na /
translated: Well then, what fault of a reason did Master Dignaga state?

analyzed: sgrub ba de srid pa'i phyir 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can srid do //
translated: Because that proof is possible, the nonerroneous contradiction is possible.

translated: In this regard, an example of a nonerroneous contradiction is that which is related to all of this place and is simultaneously related to all of it.

analyzed: des na cig car du mngon par 'brel pa can dang thams cad du song ba la nges pas des khyab pa ston to //
translated: Therefore, it is shown that the pervasion is established by the fact that the universal is simultaneously related to many and is all-pervading.

analyzed: spyi de la drang srong chen po gzegs zan ni gcig pu g-yo ba med pa yin la /

analyzed: thams cad na gnas pa rang dang 'brel pa can dag tu 'du ba'i sgo nas 'brel par smra'o //

original: 'di dag gcig gis ni gsal ba'i bar gsal bas stong pa'i nam mkha' na yod pa bsgrubs /
analyzed: 'di dag gcig gis ni gsal ba'i bar gsal bas stong pa'i nam mkha' na yod pa bsgrubs /
translated: One of these proves that in the interval of the manifestations, which is empty of manifestations, there is an existence.

original: cig shos kyis ni de mi dmigs pas na med par bsgrub par gcig la dus gcig lhan cig tu yod pa dang med pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: cig shos kyis ni de mi dmigs pas na med par bsgrub par gcig la dus gcig lhan cig tu yod pa dang med pa mi rigs te /
translated: The other, because it does not observe it, establishes its nonexistence. It is not logical for something to exist and not exist at the same time and place.

original: de gnyis gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those two are mutually exclusive.

original: lung las grub pa'i phyir ni thams cad du song ba nyid dang thams cad du song ba ma yin pa nyid dang rjes su bsgrub pa de gnyis ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: lung las grub pa'i phyir ni thams cad du song ba nyid dang thams cad du song ba ma yin pa nyid dang rjes su bsgrub pa de gnyis ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can du gyur pa yin te /
translated: Because of scripture, the two, omnipresence and nonomnipresence, are established as not being confused with each other.

original: 'di ltar ci gcig yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ci gcig yin la /
translated: In this way, how can something be

original: yul thams cad na gnas pa dang cig car mngon bar 'brel pa dang / snang bar yang khas len to //
analyzed: yul thams cad na gnas pa dang cig car mngon bar 'brel pa dang / snang bar yang khas len to //
translated: present in all places and simultaneously related to all and yet accepted as being visible?

original: de bas na 'brel pa can yin pa'i phyir thams cad du song ba nyid dang / snang ba yin pa'i phyir bar na mi dmigs pas na de thams cad du song ba ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na 'brel pa can yin pa'i phyir thams cad du song ba nyid dang / snang ba yin pa'i phyir bar na mi dmigs pas na de thams cad du song ba ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, because it is related, it is omnipresent, and because it is visible, it is not omnipresent, since it is not observed in between.

original: de bas na bstan bcos byed pas 'gal bas khyab pa ma mthong bar 'gal bas khyab chos smra ba ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa'i go skabs 'byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na bstan bcos byed pas 'gal bas khyab pa ma mthong bar 'gal bas khyab chos smra ba ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa'i go skabs 'byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, when a treatise writer, without seeing the pervasion by contradiction, speaks of the pervasion by contradiction, he opens the door to the confusion of contradiction.

original: dngos po la ni 'di mi srid do zhes bya bas gtan tshigs ltar snang ba ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po la ni 'di mi srid do zhes bya bas gtan tshigs ltar snang ba ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: But this is impossible in reality. Thus he does not teach fallacious reasons.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir ji ltar gtan @85b tshigs bstan cing de'i zhar la gtan tshigs snang ba yang bstan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir ji ltar gtan @85b tshigs bstan cing de'i zhar la gtan tshigs snang ba yang bstan pa ma yin nam /
translated: Since it is a part of the proof, why is the reason taught and incidentally the fallacious reasons taught?

original: de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir dpe dang de'i zhar la dpe ltar snang ba bstan par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir dpe dang de'i zhar la dpe ltar snang ba bstan par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, since it is a part of the proof, why is the example taught and incidentally the fallacious examples taught?

original: de ci'i phyir mi bstan ce na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir mi bstan ce na /
translated: Why are they not taught?

original: smras ba / gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid gsum smos zin pas dpe des ci zhig bya /
analyzed: smras ba / gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid gsum smos zin pas dpe des ci zhig bya /
translated: It is said: Since the three characteristics of the reason have been mentioned, what is the use of the example?

original: 'on te de tsam gyis don khong du mi chud do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de tsam gyis don khong du mi chud do zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that the meaning is not understood by that alone,

original: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said: By that alone.

original: mtshan nyid bstan zin pa'i gtan tshigs de kho nas bsgrub par bya ba rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir de kho na go bar byed ba yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid bstan zin pa'i gtan tshigs de kho nas bsgrub par bya ba rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir de kho na go bar byed ba yin no //
translated: The reason, having been taught as having the nature of a proof, is understood to be a proof of the probandum. Therefore, it is a proof.

original: de bas na de'i tshig kho na sgrub bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na de'i tshig kho na sgrub bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, only its words are a proof.

original: dpe zhes bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag ni logs shig na ci yang med do //
analyzed: dpe zhes bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag ni logs shig na ci yang med do //
translated: There is nothing else called an example that is a part of a proof.

original: gang gi phyir 'di yan lag ma yin pa de bas na dpe de'i mtshan nyid las logs shig tu ma brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di yan lag ma yin pa de bas na dpe de'i mtshan nyid las logs shig tu ma brjod do //
translated: Since it is not a part, therefore, the example is not mentioned separately from the definition of a proof.

original: 'o na gtan tshigs kyi dpe med na gtan tshigs khyab pa nges par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gtan tshigs kyi dpe med na gtan tshigs khyab pa nges par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If there is no example of a reason, then how can the pervasion of the reason be ascertained?

original: gtan tshigs kyi dpe med do zhes mi zer ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi dpe med do zhes mi zer ro //
translated: We do not say that there is no example of a reason.

original: 'on kyang gtan tshigs las logs shig na dpe zhes bya ba med de /
analyzed: 'on kyang gtan tshigs las logs shig na dpe zhes bya ba med de /
translated: However, there is no example that is separate from the reason.

original: gtan tshigs nyid du dpe 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs nyid du dpe 'dus pa yin no //
translated: The example is included in the reason itself.

original: de bas na de'i mtshan nyid logs shig tu ma brjod do zhes smras kyi /
analyzed: de bas na de'i mtshan nyid logs shig tu ma brjod do zhes smras kyi /
translated: Therefore, we say that its definition is not mentioned separately.

original: dpe'i mtshan nyid ni mi brjod do zhes de skad du ni ma smras so //
analyzed: dpe'i mtshan nyid ni mi brjod do zhes de skad du ni ma smras so //
translated: The definition of an example is not stated.

original: ci ste de lta na tshig la mkho ba'i mtshan nyid kyang brjod par bya dgos pa kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste de lta na tshig la mkho ba'i mtshan nyid kyang brjod par bya dgos pa kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the definition of a word should also be stated.

original: don go ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: don go ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because the meaning is understood.

original: go ba'i don ni dpe'i mtshan nyid gang la don te dgos pa 'am brjod par bya ba go bar yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: go ba'i don ni dpe'i mtshan nyid gang la don te dgos pa 'am brjod par bya ba go bar yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The meaning of “understood” is that which is understood, i.e., the purpose or the content, in the definition of an example.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de de bas na'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de de bas na'o //
translated: That is its nature, and that is why.

original: dpe'i mtshan nyid bshad pa ni ji ltar dpe khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir yin la /
analyzed: dpe'i mtshan nyid bshad pa ni ji ltar dpe khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir yin la /
translated: The explanation of the definition of an example is for the purpose of understanding the example.

original: dpe yang gtan gyi /
analyzed: dpe yang gtan gyi /
translated: And the example is understood from the statement of the reason.🔽But that is impossible in the case of a thing.

original: dngos po la ni 'di mi srid do zhes bya bas na de'i tshig kho na sgrub bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dngos po la ni 'di mi srid do zhes bya bas na de'i tshig kho na sgrub bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the statement itself is the proof.

original: pa gang yin pa de ni bgo ba ste /
analyzed: pa gang yin pa de ni bgo ba ste /
translated: That which is to be established is the thesis.

original: grub pa'am brjod par bya ba dpe zhes bya ba yang go ba ste shes pa yin no //
analyzed: grub pa'am brjod par bya ba dpe zhes bya ba yang go ba ste shes pa yin no //
translated: The example is the understanding, i.e., the knowledge, of the established or the content.

original: ji ltar de don go ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de don go ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is the meaning of that understood?

original: smras pa / 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa rnams kyi gtan tshigs kyi tshul de dag spyir thun mong du bye brag med par bshad zin to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: smras pa / 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa rnams kyi gtan tshigs kyi tshul de dag spyir thun mong du bye brag med par bshad zin to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said: The method of the reason of effect, nature, and non-apprehension, those have been explained in general without distinction.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa gang yin pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad @86a * //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa gang yin pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad @86a * //
translated: That which exists in the concordant class and the mode of reversal from all discordant classes,

original: las ldog pa'i tshul gnyis po de ni bye brag med par bshad zin to //
analyzed: las ldog pa'i tshul gnyis po de ni bye brag med par bshad zin to //
translated: those two have been explained without distinction.

original: spyir bshad zin kyang rtogs par mi nus pas de bas na de nyid kyi bye brag gi mtha' brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: spyir bshad zin kyang rtogs par mi nus pas de bas na de nyid kyi bye brag gi mtha' brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: Although explained in general, it cannot be understood, therefore, it is necessary to state the limit of its distinction.

original: de bas na bye brag tu ni 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gnyis skye ba dang / de tsam gyi rjes su 'jug pa yin par bstan par bya ba bshad de /
analyzed: de bas na bye brag tu ni 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gnyis skye ba dang / de tsam gyi rjes su 'jug pa yin par bstan par bya ba bshad de /
translated: Therefore, in particular, the effect and nature are taught to be the engagement of mere arising.

original: 'bras bu ni skye bar shes na ni mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad las ldog pa yin par shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni skye bar shes na ni mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad las ldog pa yin par shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the effect is known to arise, then it is known to exist only in the similar class and to be absent from all dissimilar classes.

original: rang bzhin ni de tsam gyi rjes su 'jug pa yin par bstan par bya ba bshad de /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni de tsam gyi rjes su 'jug pa yin par bstan par bya ba bshad de /
translated: The nature is taught to be the mere pervasion.

original: de zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the proof.

original: de nyid tsam yin te /
analyzed: de nyid tsam yin te /
translated: It is that alone.

original: sgrub par byed pa tsam gyis rjes su 'jug pa rjes su 'gro ba ni sgrub par byed pa tsam yod na sgrub par byed pa yod pa yin la /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa tsam gyis rjes su 'jug pa rjes su 'gro ba ni sgrub par byed pa tsam yod na sgrub par byed pa yod pa yin la /
translated: The pervasion is the mere following of the proof. The mere existence of the proof is the existence of the proof.

original: sgrub par byed pa yang gang gi tshe bsgrub par bya ba yod pa tsam nyid kyi de'i bdag nyid shes par 'gyur ba de'i tshe rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad las log par shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa yang gang gi tshe bsgrub par bya ba yod pa tsam nyid kyi de'i bdag nyid shes par 'gyur ba de'i tshe rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad las log par shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the probandum is known to be the mere existence of that, then the nature reason is known to exist only in the similar class and to be absent from all dissimilar classes.

original: de ltar na spyi'i mtshan nyid ni bye brag gi bdag nyid can du shes par bya'i /
analyzed: de ltar na spyi'i mtshan nyid ni bye brag gi bdag nyid can du shes par bya'i /
translated: Thus, the universal is to be understood as having the nature of the particular.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: But not otherwise.

original: de bas na bye brag gi mtshan nyid bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na bye brag gi mtshan nyid bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the particular is explained.

original: ci ste de lta yin na /
analyzed: ci ste de lta yin na /
translated: If that is so,

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /🔽de yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na / de yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: what is the point?🔽He says: That also is taught by the mere teaching of the particular,

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid bstan par 'dod pas bye brag gi mtshan nyid ston par byed pa kho nas bstan par bya ba yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid bstan par 'dod pas bye brag gi mtshan nyid ston par byed pa kho nas bstan par bya ba yin par sbyar ro //
translated: by one who wishes to teach the universal.🔽Where there is smoke, there is fire,

original: gang na du ba yod pa de na me yod la zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la khyab par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gang na du ba yod pa de na me yod la zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la khyab par bstan pa yin te /
translated: he teaches the pervasion in the case of an effect-inferential sign.

original: khyab pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bsgrub pa'i phyir tshad ma las nges pa yin no //
analyzed: khyab pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bsgrub pa'i phyir tshad ma las nges pa yin no //
translated: And the pervasion is ascertained by means of a valid cognition in order to establish the relation of cause and effect.

original: de bas na dper na tshang bang lta bu'i zhes brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de bas na dper na tshang bang lta bu'i zhes brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, it should be said: “For example, like a kitchen.”🔽Where there is no fire, there is no smoke,

original: me med na du ba yang med do zhes bya ba ni ldog pa bstan to //
analyzed: me med na du ba yang med do zhes bya ba ni ldog pa bstan to //
translated: he teaches the counter-pervasion.

original: de yang dper na gzhan pa lta bu'i zhes bya bar bstan par bya dgos te /
analyzed: de yang dper na gzhan pa lta bu'i zhes bya bar bstan par bya dgos te /
translated: Moreover, it must be shown that it is like something else.

original: me log na du ba nges par ldog pa yin par bstan par bya dgos la /
analyzed: me log na du ba nges par ldog pa yin par bstan par bya dgos la /
translated: When fire is refuted, smoke must be shown to be definitely refuted.

original: de yang tshang bang las gzhan pa lta bu'i zhes bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang tshang bang las gzhan pa lta bu'i zhes bstan par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it must be shown that it is like something other than a kitchen.

original: gang na byas pa nyid yod pa de na rtag pa nyid yod la zhes bya bas ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la khyab par bstan to //
analyzed: gang na byas pa nyid yod pa de na rtag pa nyid yod la zhes bya bas ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la khyab par bstan to //
translated: “ Where there is the state of being produced, there is the state of being impermanent” shows the pervasion in a natural inference.

original: mi rtag pa @86b nyid yin na byas pa yang mi srid de zhes bya bas ni ldog pa bstan to //
analyzed: mi rtag pa @86b nyid yin na byas pa yang mi srid de zhes bya bas ni ldog pa bstan to //
translated: “ If something is impermanent, it cannot possibly be produced” shows the contraposition.

original: khyab pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yang chos dang mthun pa'i dpe las bstan par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: khyab pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yang chos dang mthun pa'i dpe las bstan par bya ba yin la /
translated: The valid knowledge that proves the pervasion must be shown from a concordant example.

original: khyab par rab tu grub pa'i gtan tshigs kyang bsgrub par bya ba log na ldog par bstan par bya dgos so //
analyzed: khyab par rab tu grub pa'i gtan tshigs kyang bsgrub par bya ba log na ldog par bstan par bya dgos so //
translated: A reason that is well established as a pervasion must be shown to be contraposed if the predicate is reversed.

original: de bas na gdon mi za bar de dper na /
analyzed: de bas na gdon mi za bar de dper na /
translated: Therefore, it must be shown that it is like something else.

original: bum pa dang nam mkha' lta bu'o zhes bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bum pa dang nam mkha' lta bu'o zhes bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: It is like a pot and space.

original: de ltar ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba smos te /🔽gang gi phyir gzhan du na spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo mthun pa'i phyogs dag la yod pa dang med pa ji skad smos pa'i rnam pa dag ces bya ba mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod par nges pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa kho
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba smos te / gang gi phyir gzhan du na spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo mthun pa'i phyogs dag la yod pa dang med pa ji skad smos pa'i rnam pa dag ces bya ba mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod par nges pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa kho
translated: Otherwise, it is said.

original: nar nges pa ji skad du smos pa'i rnam pa de dag bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: nar nges pa ji skad du smos pa'i rnam pa de dag bstan par mi nus so //
translated: Because otherwise, the universal characteristic cannot be taught as the existence and non-existence in the similar instances in the above-mentioned way, and the particular characteristic cannot be taught as the existence and non-existence in the similar and dissimilar instances in the above-mentioned way.

original: bye brag gi mtshan nyid bstan nas ni ji skad smos pa'i rnam pa yod pa dang med pa nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bye brag gi mtshan nyid bstan nas ni ji skad smos pa'i rnam pa yod pa dang med pa nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: The particular characteristic is taught after the universal characteristic, and the existence and non-existence in the above-mentioned way are taught.

original: bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyang gzhan du bstan par mi nus te /🔽bsgrub par bya ba de'i 'bras bu ni de'i 'bras bu ste du ba'o //
analyzed: bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyang gzhan du bstan par mi nus te / bsgrub par bya ba de'i 'bras bu ni de'i 'bras bu ste du ba'o //
translated: The particular characteristic cannot be taught otherwise.🔽The effect of that is the effect of that. Smoke is the effect of that.

original: de'i dngos po ni de'i 'bras bu nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de'i 'bras bu nyid do //
translated: The state of that is the state of the effect of that.

original: de nyid nges pa yin te //
analyzed: de nyid nges pa yin te //
translated: That is the definition of the ascertained.

original: 'di ltar me la du ba ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar me la du ba ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa yin no //
translated: Thus, smoke is ascertained as the effect of fire.

original: de'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo gang yin pa de ni gzhan du bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo gang yin pa de ni gzhan du bstan par mi nus so //
translated: The definition of the nature of a particular is that which is ascertained as the effect of that. It cannot be taught as something else.

original: rang bzhin gyi rtags ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par yin pa'i bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo yang gzhan du bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi rtags ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par yin pa'i bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo yang gzhan du bstan par mi nus so //
translated: The definition of the nature of a particular is that which is the specific characteristic of the probandum's nature. It cannot be taught as something else.

original: 'di ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / de'i bdag nyid kyis dngos po tshang bang dang bum pa las shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / de'i bdag nyid kyis dngos po tshang bang dang bum pa las shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the existence of a thing is understood from cause and effect, and from identity.

original: de bas na khyab pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad mas ston par ni chos dang mthun pa'i dpe bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na khyab pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad mas ston par ni chos dang mthun pa'i dpe bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, in order to establish the pervasion, a concordant example should be shown by the means of valid cognition that proves it.

original: de'i 'bras bu nyid du rab tu bsgrub pa la ni rgyu'i dngos po med pa yin par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir chos dang mi mthun pa'i dpe bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyid du rab tu bsgrub pa la ni rgyu'i dngos po med pa yin par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir chos dang mi mthun pa'i dpe bstan pa yin no //
translated: In order to establish that very result, the example that is discordant with the property is taught in order to make one understand that the state of being a cause does not exist.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gdon mi za bar dngos po yang ma yin rgyu'i ngo bo med na 'bras bu'i ngo bo med pa ni dngos po'am dngos po ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gdon mi za bar dngos po yang ma yin rgyu'i ngo bo med na 'bras bu'i ngo bo med pa ni dngos po'am dngos po ma yin pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is definitely not a thing, and if the state of being a cause does not exist, the state of being a result does not exist, whether it is a thing or a nonthing.

original: de ltar na dngos po 'am dngos po med pa chos dang mi mthun pa'i dper 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po 'am dngos po med pa chos dang mi mthun pa'i dper 'dod do //
translated: Thus a thing or a nonthing is asserted to be an example that is discordant with the property.

original: de bas na dpe med pa ni gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba'am ldog pa bstan par mi nus so //🔽de'i phyir na gtan @87a * //
analyzed: de bas na dpe med pa ni gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba'am ldog pa bstan par mi nus so // de'i phyir na gtan @87a * //
translated: Therefore, in the absence of an example, it is impossible to teach the pervasion of the reason.

original: tshigs kyi tshul bshad pa kho nas gtan tshigs la khyab pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ston par byed pa chos dang mthun pa'i dpe yin la /
analyzed: tshigs kyi tshul bshad pa kho nas gtan tshigs la khyab pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ston par byed pa chos dang mthun pa'i dpe yin la /
translated: Therefore, the valid knowledge that proves the pervasion of the reason is taught by the explanation of the mode of the reason alone. The example that is concordant with the property🔽is the proof.

original: khyab par rab tu bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyang grub pa med na med pa gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir chos dang mi mthun pa'i dpe blang bar bya ba yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: khyab par rab tu bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyang grub pa med na med pa gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir chos dang mi mthun pa'i dpe blang bar bya ba yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The example that is discordant with the property is to be employed when the reason that establishes the pervasion is not established.

original: don 'di bstan na dpe bstan pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don 'di bstan na dpe bstan pa kho na yin te /
translated: When this meaning is taught, the example is taught.

original: khyab pa grub pa'i tshad ma ston pa dang ldog pa ston pa grub pa med na me blang bar bya ba'i don gang yin pa de'i don bstan pa na yang dpe bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: khyab pa grub pa'i tshad ma ston pa dang ldog pa ston pa grub pa med na me blang bar bya ba'i don gang yin pa de'i don bstan pa na yang dpe bstan pa yin no //
translated: When the meaning of the example that is to be employed when the means of establishing the pervasion and the means of teaching the contrapositive are not established is taught, the example is taught.🔽Why is this?

original: 'di ga las she na bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na bshad pa /
translated: It is said:

original: gang gi tshul de tsam du zad pa de'i dngos po ni de nyid de bas na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshul de tsam du zad pa de'i dngos po ni de nyid de bas na'o //
translated: The nature of that which has only that much as its mode is just that.

original: dpe'i tshul ni de tsam du zad de /
analyzed: dpe'i tshul ni de tsam du zad de /
translated: The mode of the example is only that much.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: khyab pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad mas ston pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos dang mthun pa'i dpe yin la /
analyzed: khyab pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad mas ston pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos dang mthun pa'i dpe yin la /
translated: The means of establishing the pervasion is taught.

original: khyab pa rab tu grub pa la yang bsgrub par bya ba log na ldog pa rab tu ston pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: khyab pa rab tu grub pa la yang bsgrub par bya ba log na ldog pa rab tu ston pa nyid yin te /
translated: And in the case of a pervasion that is well established, it is the very fact that the reason is reversed when the probandum is reversed that is shown.

original: de yang gtan tshigs kyi ngo bo bshad pa kho nas bshad pa yin pas de'i mtshan nyid kyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de yang gtan tshigs kyi ngo bo bshad pa kho nas bshad pa yin pas de'i mtshan nyid kyis ci zhig bya /
translated: And since that is explained by the very explanation of the nature of the reason, what use is its definition?

original: gtan tshigs kyi tshul bshad pa las dpe'i de kho na nyid bstan pa 'dis ni dpe'i nyes pa dpe ltar snang ba yang bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi tshul bshad pa las dpe'i de kho na nyid bstan pa 'dis ni dpe'i nyes pa dpe ltar snang ba yang bstan pa yin te /
translated: From the explanation of the modes of the reason, this teaching on the reality of the example also teaches the faults of the example, which are the seeming examples.

original: 'di ltar sngar bshad pa grub par bya ba'i phyir dpe blangs ba yin yang rang gi 'bras bu sgrub par byed mi nus pa de ni dpe'i nyes pa yin no zhes shugs kyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sngar bshad pa grub par bya ba'i phyir dpe blangs ba yin yang rang gi 'bras bu sgrub par byed mi nus pa de ni dpe'i nyes pa yin no zhes shugs kyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, although an example is cited in order to establish what was explained earlier, if it is unable to establish its own result, that is a fault of the example. This is implicitly taught.

original: dper na zhes bya bas ni dpe ltar snang ba'i dpe dgod pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya bas ni dpe ltar snang ba'i dpe dgod pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “for example” presents an example of a seeming example.

original: sgra ni rtag pa yin te zhes bya ba ni sgra rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sgra ni rtag pa yin te zhes bya ba ni sgra rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: The phrase “sound is permanent” is the probandum, the permanence of sound.

original: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: “Because it is not a body” is the reason.

original: las dang rdul phra rab dang bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de dag ni chos dang mthun pa'i dpe bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: las dang rdul phra rab dang bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de dag ni chos dang mthun pa'i dpe bstan pa yin no //
translated: “Like action, atoms, and a pot” are the examples that are similar to the property.

original: de dag kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa'i chos dang / gnyi ga med pa'i dpe nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa'i chos dang / gnyi ga med pa'i dpe nyes pa yin no //
translated: Those are the faults of the example in which the probandum and the probans and both are absent.

original: bsgrub par bya ba med pa ni las te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med pa ni las te /
translated: The probandum is absent in action.

original: de mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impermanent.

original: sgrub par byed pa med pa ni rdul phra rab yin te /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa med pa ni rdul phra rab yin te /
translated: The probans is absent in atoms.

original: rdul phra rab rnams lus can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams lus can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because atoms are bodies.

original: rdzas thams cad du song ba ma yin pa tshad ma yod pa ni lus can yin la /
analyzed: rdzas thams cad du song ba ma yin pa tshad ma yod pa ni lus can yin la /
translated: That which is not all-pervading and has measure is a body.

original: thams cad du song ba ma yin pa dang / rdzas kyi rdul phra rab ni bye brag pa dag rtag par 'dod do //
analyzed: thams cad du song ba ma yin pa dang / rdzas kyi rdul phra rab ni bye brag pa dag rtag par 'dod do //
translated: The Vaiśeṣikas assert that atoms are permanent and are not all-pervading and are not substances.

original: de bas na bsgrub par bya ba med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bsgrub par bya ba med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the probandum is not absent.

original: @87b bum pa ni gnyis ka med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: @87b bum pa ni gnyis ka med pa ma yin te /
translated: A pot is not absent in both.

original: bum pa mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir dang lus can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir dang lus can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the pot is impermanent and because it has a body.

original: de bzhin du gang la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la the tshom za ba de ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la the tshom za'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la the tshom za ba de ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la the tshom za'o //
translated: Similarly, one who doubts the property to be established doubts the property to be established.

original: de la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Those who are like this are said to be like this.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la the tshom za ba dang / sgrub par byed pa'i chos la the tshom za ba dag gnyi ga la the tshom za'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la the tshom za ba dang / sgrub par byed pa'i chos la the tshom za ba dag gnyi ga la the tshom za'o //
translated: One who doubts the property to be established and one who doubts the reason are both said to doubt.

original: dper na zhes bya ba ni dpe 'god pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ni dpe 'god pa yin te /
translated: For example is the statement of an example.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: Possessed of attachment, etc. is the property to be established.

original: smra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: smra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: Because he speaks is the reason.

original: lam po che'i mi bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe la ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid la the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: lam po che'i mi bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe la ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid la the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: In the example of the man on the road, there is doubt about being possessed of attachment, etc.

original: 'di ni 'chi ba'i chos dang ldan pa yin pas 'chi ba'i chos can yin pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'chi ba'i chos dang ldan pa yin pas 'chi ba'i chos can yin pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: This is the property of the probandum, and the person who possesses it is the probandum.

original: mi 'di ni zhes bya ba ni chos can yin no //
analyzed: mi 'di ni zhes bya ba ni chos can yin no //
translated: The person who is on the road is the subject.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: The reason is: because he is possessed of desire, etc.

original: lam po che'i mi bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe la yod pa the tshom za ba yin la /
analyzed: lam po che'i mi bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe la yod pa the tshom za ba yin la /
translated: The example is: like the person on the road.

original: bsgrub par bya ba 'chi ba'i chos can du nges pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba 'chi ba'i chos can du nges pa yin no //
translated: The probandum is the person who possesses the property of death.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te zhes bya ba thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te zhes bya ba thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: The probandum is: he is not omniscient.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: The reason is: because he is possessed of desire, etc.

original: de gnyi ga yang lam po che'i mi'i dpe las thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa yang yod pas the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang lam po che'i mi'i dpe las thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa yang yod pas the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: Both of these are doubtful in the example of the person on the road, because there is someone who is omniscient and who is not possessed of desire, etc.

original: de bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba med pa zhes bya ba ni dpe gang la bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa gnyis srid pa tsam du snang ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba med pa zhes bya ba ni dpe gang la bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa gnyis srid pa tsam du snang ba la /
translated: Similarly, the absence of concomitance is when the example is such that the presence of the probandum and the probans is merely possible.

original: sgrub par byed pas khyab pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs de ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pas khyab pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs de ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The reason that is not pervaded by the probans is called the absence of concomitance.

original: rjes su 'go ba rab tu ma bstan pa ni dpe gang la rjes su 'gro ba yod kyang smra ba pos ma bstan pa de ni rjes su 'gro ba ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'go ba rab tu ma bstan pa ni dpe gang la rjes su 'gro ba yod kyang smra ba pos ma bstan pa de ni rjes su 'gro ba ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: The non-demonstration of concomitance is when the example has concomitance but the speaker does not demonstrate it. That is the non-demonstration of concomitance.

original: dper na zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i dpe dgod pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i dpe dgod pa yin no //
translated: For example is the statement of an example of the absence of concomitance.

original: gang smras pa de ni zhes bya bas smras pa nyid rjes su brjod nas 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang smras pa de ni zhes bya bas smras pa nyid rjes su brjod nas 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: What is said is... is the statement of the probandum, which is the possession of attachment and so on, after repeating what was said.

original: de bas na smra ba nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa nges pa na khyab pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na smra ba nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa nges pa na khyab pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when speaking is ascertained to be the possession of attachment and so on, the pervasion is demonstrated.

original: 'dod pa'i mi @88a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i mi @88a * //
translated: The person who is desirous...🔽is the statement of the example of the absence of concomitance.

original: bzhin no zhes bya ba la 'dod pa'i sgras slar rgol ba yang gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin no zhes bya ba la 'dod pa'i sgras slar rgol ba yang gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The word desire should be taken to include the opponent.

original: des na 'dod pa'i mi la smra ba nyid dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa gnyis yod pa tsam du ni grub na khyab pa ma grub ste /
analyzed: des na 'dod pa'i mi la smra ba nyid dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa gnyis yod pa tsam du ni grub na khyab pa ma grub ste /
translated: Thus, if it is established that there is mere existence of the two, the one who speaks with desire and the one who possesses desire and so on, then the pervasion is not established.

original: des na rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i dpe yin no //
analyzed: des na rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i dpe yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is an example of lack of concomitance.

original: sgra mi rtag pa ste zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra mi rtag pa ste zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: Sound is impermanent is the probandum.

original: byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs go //
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs go //
translated: Because it is produced is the reason.

original: bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe 'di la rjes su 'gro ba ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe 'di la rjes su 'gro ba ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: Like a pot is the example. In this example, the concomitance is not shown.

original: 'dir byas pa nyid du bum pa dang sgra 'dra mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir byas pa nyid du bum pa dang sgra 'dra mod kyi /
translated: Here, although a pot and sound are similar in being produced,

original: 'on kyang mi rtag pa'i sgo nas 'dra bar mi rtogs par mi nus te ;
analyzed: 'on kyang mi rtag pa'i sgo nas 'dra bar mi rtogs par mi nus te ;
translated: nevertheless, it is not possible to not understand them as similar in terms of impermanence.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would lead to absurdity.

original: ci ste byas pa nyid mi rtag pa'i ngo bo yin par shes par gyur na ni de lta na ni byas pa yin pa'i phyir mi rtag par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste byas pa nyid mi rtag pa'i ngo bo yin par shes par gyur na ni de lta na ni byas pa yin pa'i phyir mi rtag par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: If one understands that the nature of the produced is impermanence, then in that case, one would understand impermanence because of being produced.

original: de bas na gang byas pa de ni mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba nyid mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa brjod nas nges ba bsgrub pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba'i tshig gi don rtogs par bya ba'i yul dper blangs pa yin la /
analyzed: de bas na gang byas pa de ni mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba nyid mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa brjod nas nges ba bsgrub pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba'i tshig gi don rtogs par bya ba'i yul dper blangs pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, since it is stated that “whatever is produced is impermanent,” in order to establish the thesis, the example is cited as the object to be understood as the meaning of the term that is concomitant.

original: don de yang rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: don de yang rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: And that meaning is shown to be concomitant.

original: 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba'i tshig ma smras pa kho nar dper blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba'i tshig ma smras pa kho nar dper blangs pa yin no //
translated: This is the example cited without stating the term that is concomitant.

original: 'di 'dra ba ni chos dang mthun pa tsam kho nar nye bar sbyar ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba ni chos dang mthun pa tsam kho nar nye bar sbyar ba yin la /
translated: This is merely applied as a property of the subject.

original: chos dang mthun pas ni bsgrub par bya ba mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: chos dang mthun pas ni bsgrub par bya ba mi 'grub bo //
translated: And the property of the subject is not established by the property of the subject.

original: de bas na rjes su 'gro ba'i don dang ldan pa dpe yin la /
analyzed: de bas na rjes su 'gro ba'i don dang ldan pa dpe yin la /
translated: Therefore, the example has the meaning of the concomitant.

original: don de yang 'dir ma blangs la /
analyzed: don de yang 'dir ma blangs la /
translated: And that meaning is not cited here.

original: chos dang mthun pa'i don blangs pa nye bar mkho ba ma yin te /
analyzed: chos dang mthun pa'i don blangs pa nye bar mkho ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not necessary to take the meaning in accordance with the doctrine.

original: de bas 'di smra ba pos nyes pa'i phyir dpe'i nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas 'di smra ba pos nyes pa'i phyir dpe'i nyes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is a fault of the example because of the fault of the speaker.

original: smra ba pos ni 'dir gzhan la khong du chud par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: smra ba pos ni 'dir gzhan la khong du chud par bya ba yin no //
translated: For, the speaker here is to be understood as another.

original: de bas na ci ste dngos po la skyon med mod kyi /
analyzed: de bas na ci ste dngos po la skyon med mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, if there is no fault in the thing itself,

original: 'on kyang smra ba pos nyes par bstan pa yin pas nyes pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang smra ba pos nyes par bstan pa yin pas nyes pa nyid yin no //
translated: nevertheless, it is a fault because the speaker has been shown to be at fault.

original: de bzhin du dpe gang las rjes su 'gro ba phyin ci log yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dpe gang las rjes su 'gro ba phyin ci log yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Similarly, that example is said to have a reversed pervasion when there is a reversed pervasion in the example.

original: gang mi rtag pa de ni byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi dpe dgod pa byas pa nyid kyi dpe rtag pa nges par ni dpe bstan par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de ni byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi dpe dgod pa byas pa nyid kyi dpe rtag pa nges par ni dpe bstan par bya ba yin te /
translated: As for the statement “Whatever is impermanent is produced,” that is the statement of the example itself. The example of being produced is “Whatever is permanent is necessarily an example.”

original: de lta na ni byas pa'i phyir mi rtag pa khong du chud par 'gyur ba zhig na 'dir ni mi rtag pa la byas pa nyid nges par yod par bstan pas byas pa nyid du mi rtag pa la nges pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni byas pa'i phyir mi rtag pa khong du chud par 'gyur ba zhig na 'dir ni mi rtag pa la byas pa nyid nges par yod par bstan pas byas pa nyid du mi rtag pa la nges pa kho na yin no //
translated: If that were so, then impermanence would be understood because of being produced. But here, impermanence is definitely taught to exist in what is produced, so impermanence definitely exists in what is produced.

original: de bas na byas pa nyid mi rtag pa nyid @88b la nges par yod pa ma yin par bstan pa ci 'dra ba de 'dra bas ni mi rtag pa khong du chud pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na byas pa nyid mi rtag pa nyid @88b la nges par yod pa ma yin par bstan pa ci 'dra ba de 'dra bas ni mi rtag pa khong du chud pa med do //
translated: Therefore, just as impermanence is taught not to definitely exist in what is produced, in the same way, impermanence is not understood.

original: de ltar gang mi rtag pa zhes bya bas mi rtag pa rjes su brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar gang mi rtag pa zhes bya bas mi rtag pa rjes su brjod nas /
translated: Thus, having stated impermanence with the phrase “what is impermanent,”

original: da ni byas pa po zhes bya bas byas pa nyid bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: da ni byas pa po zhes bya bas byas pa nyid bsgrub pa'o //
translated: now, with the phrase “what is produced,” production is established.

original: de bas na mi rtag pa nyid byas pa la nges par yod par bstan gyi /
analyzed: de bas na mi rtag pa nyid byas pa la nges par yod par bstan gyi /
translated: Therefore, impermanence is taught to definitely exist in what is produced,

original: byas pa nyid ni mi rtag pa la ma bstan to //
analyzed: byas pa nyid ni mi rtag pa la ma bstan to //
translated: but production is not taught to definitely exist in what is impermanent.

original: de ltar dper na mi rtag pa nyid ni brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid la nges par yod pa ma yin pas brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid rtogs par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du byas pa nyid las mi rtag pa nyid khong du
analyzed: de ltar dper na mi rtag pa nyid ni brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid la nges par yod pa ma yin pas brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid rtogs par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du byas pa nyid las mi rtag pa nyid khong du
translated: For example, impermanence is not definitely present in that which arises immediately after being sought, and thus the realization of that which arises immediately after being sought does not occur.

original: chud par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: chud par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Likewise, impermanence is not understood from that which is produced.

original: mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir byas pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir byas pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is impermanent, it is that which is produced.

original: byas pa nyid ni dngos po gnas pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la nges par yod pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: byas pa nyid ni dngos po gnas pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la nges par yod pa yin mod kyi /
translated: That which is produced definitely exists in the impermanence of a thing’s endurance.

original: 'on kyang smra bas nges par yod pa ma yin par bstan pa de bas na rang skyon can ma yin yang smra bas nyes ba'i phyir skyon yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang smra bas nges par yod pa ma yin par bstan pa de bas na rang skyon can ma yin yang smra bas nyes ba'i phyir skyon yin no //
translated: However, the proponent has not taught that it definitely exists. Therefore, although it is not the fault of the proponent, it is a fault.

original: de bas na rjes su 'gro ba phyin ci log kyang rjes su dpag pa la smra ba po'i nyes pa las yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na rjes su 'gro ba phyin ci log kyang rjes su dpag pa la smra ba po'i nyes pa las yin gyi /
translated: Thus, even if the forward pervasion is reversed, it is due to the fault of the proponent in the inference,

original: dngos po'i ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i ni ma yin te /
translated: but not due to the thing.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la ni smra ba po nyes pa yang bsam par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la ni smra ba po nyes pa yang bsam par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the case of an inference for the sake of others, one must consider the faults of the speaker.

original: chos mthun pa'i dpe'i nyes pa rnam pa dgu bstan nas chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i nyes pa rnam pa dgu bstan pa'i phyir smras pa ;
analyzed: chos mthun pa'i dpe'i nyes pa rnam pa dgu bstan nas chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i nyes pa rnam pa dgu bstan pa'i phyir smras pa ;
translated: Having taught the nine faults of a similar example, in order to teach the nine faults of a dissimilar example, [Dharmakīrti] said:

original: sgra rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya zhing lus can ma yin pa gtan tshigs su bya ba la /
analyzed: sgra rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya zhing lus can ma yin pa gtan tshigs su bya ba la /
translated: Sound is to be proven as permanent, and non-embodiment is used as the reason.

original: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe rdul phra rab ni bsgrub par bya ba ldog pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe rdul phra rab ni bsgrub par bya ba ldog pa med pa yin te /
translated: In a dissimilar example, such as a particle, the predicate to be proven is not absent.

original: rdul phra rab rnams ni rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams ni rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because particles are permanent.

original: las kyi sgrub par byed pa'i ldog pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: las kyi sgrub par byed pa'i ldog pa med pa yin te /
translated: The agent of action is not absent.

original: las rnams lus can ma yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: las rnams lus can ma yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because actions are non-embodied.

original: / nam mkha' ni gnyi ga log pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: / nam mkha' ni gnyi ga log pa med pa yin te /
translated: Space is not absent in both.

original: rtag pa yin pa'i phyir dang / lus can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa yin pa'i phyir dang / lus can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is permanent and non-embodied.

original: bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Those which are the probandum, etc. are the probandum, etc.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa gnyi ga'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa gnyi ga'o //
translated: Both the probandum and the probans are the probandum, etc.

original: de dag ldog pa yod pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ldog pa yod pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: They do not have a reversal.

original: de gang dag la yod pa de dag ni bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa ldog pa med pa can no //
analyzed: de gang dag la yod pa de dag ni bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa ldog pa med pa can no //
translated: Those which have that are those which do not have a reversal of the probandum, etc.

original: de'i dpe bstan zin to //
analyzed: de'i dpe bstan zin to //
translated: The example of that has already been explained.

original: dpe gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin du zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dpe gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin du zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to teach another example, he says, “Similarly, etc.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ldog pa ni bsgrub par bya ba ldog pa ste /🔽gang du bsgrub par bya ba ldog pa la the tshom @89a * //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ldog pa ni bsgrub par bya ba ldog pa ste / gang du bsgrub par bya ba ldog pa la the tshom @89a * //
translated: The reversal of the probandum is the reversal of the probandum.

original: za ba de ni bsgrub par bya ba ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: za ba de ni bsgrub par bya ba ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: Where there is doubt about the reversal of the probandum, there is doubt about the reversal of the probandum.

original: de la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those which have that and so forth are called that.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i dper bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i dper bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to give an example of doubt about the reversal of the probandum, he says,

original: dper na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “For example, etc.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba gcig go //
translated: “He is not omniscient” is the one thing to be proven.

original: yid ches pa ma yin no zhes bya ba nyes pa ma zad do zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: yid ches pa ma yin no zhes bya ba nyes pa ma zad do zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa'o //
translated: “He is not trustworthy” is the second thing to be proven, since the fault is not exhausted.

original: ser skya la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
analyzed: ser skya la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
translated: “Kaṇāda, etc.” is the subject.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: “Omniscience, freedom from attachment, etc.” is the reason.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa dang yid ches pa de gnyis kyi rtags su gyur pa'i tshad ma phul du phyin pa ni rtags kyi bdag nyid tshad ma'i bye brag go //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa dang yid ches pa de gnyis kyi rtags su gyur pa'i tshad ma phul du phyin pa ni rtags kyi bdag nyid tshad ma'i bye brag go //
translated: The highest authority that is a sign of those two, omniscience and trustworthiness, is a particular kind of authority that has the nature of a sign.

original: gang la yang thams cad mkhyen pa dang yid ches pa'i rtags su gyur pa tshad ma phul du phyin pa yod pa bstan pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la yang thams cad mkhyen pa dang yid ches pa'i rtags su gyur pa tshad ma phul du phyin pa yod pa bstan pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: One who has the highest authority that is a sign of omniscience and trustworthiness is called that.

original: de 'dra ba'i bstan pa gang dag gi dngos po ni de nyid de bas na'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i bstan pa gang dag gi dngos po ni de nyid de bas na'o //
translated: The thing that is such a teaching is that itself, therefore.

original: tshad ma phul du phyin pa ni 'dir skad ma'i shes pa'i man ngag la bsams te /
analyzed: tshad ma phul du phyin pa ni 'dir skad ma'i shes pa'i man ngag la bsams te /
translated: The highest degree of valid cognition is considered here to be the instruction of the science of astrology.

original: ser skya la sogs pa ci ste thams cad mkhyen pa'am yid ches pa yin na ni de'i tshe skar ma shes pa la sogs pa yang ci'i phyir ma bstan /🔽ma bstan pa de bas na thams cad mkhyen pa'am /
analyzed: ser skya la sogs pa ci ste thams cad mkhyen pa'am yid ches pa yin na ni de'i tshe skar ma shes pa la sogs pa yang ci'i phyir ma bstan / ma bstan pa de bas na thams cad mkhyen pa'am /
translated: If Kapila and so on were omniscient or reliable, then why did they not teach the science of astrology?🔽Since they did not teach it, they were not omniscient

original: yid ches pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yid ches pa ma yin no //
translated: or reliable.

original: tshad ma 'dir ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ni /
analyzed: tshad ma 'dir ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ni /
translated: The example of the dissimilar class is

original: gnag zhig thams cad mkhyen pa'am yid ches pa de ni skar ma shes pa la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa'am yid ches pa'i rtags su gyur par bstan te /
analyzed: gnag zhig thams cad mkhyen pa'am yid ches pa de ni skar ma shes pa la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa'am yid ches pa'i rtags su gyur par bstan te /
translated: If someone were omniscient or reliable, then he would be a sign of omniscience or reliability with regard to the science of astrology.

original: dper na khyu mchog dang ldong ris dang de smra ba gang yin pa khyu mchog dang ldong ris la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dper na khyu mchog dang ldong ris dang de smra ba gang yin pa khyu mchog dang ldong ris la sogs pa ste /
translated: For example, the teachers of Kapila, Akṣapāda, and so on are omniscient and reliable with regard to the science of astrology.

original: nam mkha'i gos can la sogs pa'i ston pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa dang yid ches pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i gos can la sogs pa'i ston pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa dang yid ches pa yin no //
translated: The teachers of Kapila, Akṣapāda, and so on are omniscient and reliable with regard to the science of astrology.

original: de la 'dir chos dang mi mthun pa'i dpe khyu mchog dang ldong ris la sogs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa dang yid ches pa ma yin pa nyid ldog pa the tshom za ba yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir chos dang mi mthun pa'i dpe khyu mchog dang ldong ris la sogs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa dang yid ches pa ma yin pa nyid ldog pa the tshom za ba yin te /
translated: Here, the examples of the bull, the Brahman, etc., which are not in accord with the Dharma, are uncertain in the sense that they are not omniscient and are not credible.

original: 'di ltar skar ma shes pa yang ston la /
analyzed: 'di ltar skar ma shes pa yang ston la /
translated: For example, one may know the stars,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa yang ma yin pa'am yid ches pa ma yin par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa yang ma yin pa'am yid ches pa ma yin par 'gyur mod /
translated: but one is not omniscient or credible.

original: 'di la 'gal ba ci yod /
analyzed: 'di la 'gal ba ci yod /
translated: What is the contradiction here?

original: shes pa 'di ni ltas can 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: shes pa 'di ni ltas can 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: This knowledge is a delusion of the astrologer;

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su dpog par byed par mi rung ngo /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su dpog par byed par mi rung ngo /
translated: it is not suitable to infer omniscience.

original: gang du bsgrub par bya ba ldog pa la the tshom za @89b ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang du bsgrub par bya ba ldog pa la the tshom za @89b ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: This is said of that which is uncertain in the negation of the probandum.

original: dper na zhes bya ba ni de'i dpe'o //🔽nges brngod kyi rig byed dang snyan dang gas kyi rig byed dang / mchod sbyin can rnams kyi rig byed gsum ni gsum ste /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ni de'i dpe'o // nges brngod kyi rig byed dang snyan dang gas kyi rig byed dang / mchod sbyin can rnams kyi rig byed gsum ni gsum ste /
translated: For example is the example of that.🔽The three Vedas of the Nigamas, the Sāma Vedas, and the Yajus Vedas are the three.

original: de rtogs pa ni gsum rig pa'o //
analyzed: de rtogs pa ni gsum rig pa'o //
translated: The one who understands them is the one who knows the three.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i ser skya la sogs pa gang la des gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i tshig yod pa ste /🔽bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i ser skya la sogs pa gang la des gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i tshig yod pa ste / bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: The probandum is that he has words which are not to be grasped.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The reason is because he is endowed with desire, etc.

original: 'dis chos mi mthun pa'i dpes gang la bsgrub par bya ba med pas khyab pa ston pa de ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
analyzed: 'dis chos mi mthun pa'i dpes gang la bsgrub par bya ba med pas khyab pa ston pa de ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
translated: This is the dissimilar example which shows the pervasion by the absence of the probandum.

original: gang dag yin pa gzung bar bya ba yod pa de ni tshig gzung bar bya ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang dag yin pa gzung bar bya ba yod pa de ni tshig gzung bar bya ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That which is to be grasped is the words which are to be grasped.

original: bsgrub par bya ba la log par rjes su brjod nas /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba la log par rjes su brjod nas /
translated: Having stated the opposite of the probandum,🔽he is not endowed with desire, etc.

original: de ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa ste zhes bya bas ni sgrub par byed pa med pa sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa ste zhes bya bas ni sgrub par byed pa med pa sgrub pa'o //
translated: This is the establishment of the absence of the reason.

original: goo ta ma la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: goo ta ma la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
translated: As for those who are called Gautama, etc., it is said:

original: drang srong yid ches byung ba la sogs pa chos kyi bstan bcos dran pa de dag ni byed pa po yin te /
analyzed: drang srong yid ches byung ba la sogs pa chos kyi bstan bcos dran pa de dag ni byed pa po yin te /
translated: The authors of the treatises are those who remember the treatises, such as the Rg Veda, etc.,

original: gsum rig pa'i bram zhes tshig gzung bar bya zhing bstan bcos byed pa yang yin te /
analyzed: gsum rig pa'i bram zhes tshig gzung bar bya zhing bstan bcos byed pa yang yin te /
translated: and are called “brahmins who know the three Vedas” and are authors of treatises.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba yang de yin no zhes bya ba goo ta ma la sogs pa'i chos can ni ldog pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba yang de yin no zhes bya ba goo ta ma la sogs pa'i chos can ni ldog pa'i yul yin no //
translated: The subject, such as Gautama, etc., is the object of exclusion, who are free from attachment.
