original: goo ta ma la sogs pa las sgrub pa'i chos dang 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin te /🔽de dag gis tshig gzung bar byed pa yin zhing gsum rig pa yin yang 'on kyang ci de dag ci 'dod dang bcas pa yin nam /
analyzed: goo ta ma la sogs pa las sgrub pa'i chos dang 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin te / de dag gis tshig gzung bar byed pa yin zhing gsum rig pa yin yang 'on kyang ci de dag ci 'dod dang bcas pa yin nam /
translated: One doubts whether those who possess the qualities of being established by Gautama, etc., and being attached, etc., are excluded.

original: 'on te 'dod chags dang bral ba yin zhes the tshom za'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'dod chags dang bral ba yin zhes the tshom za'o //
translated: One doubts whether they are to be accepted as authorities, and whether they know the three Vedas, but one doubts whether they are free from attachment.

original: gang la gnyi ga ldog pa la the tshom za ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la gnyi ga ldog pa la the tshom za ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: One who doubts both the exclusion and the inclusion is called “one who doubts both.”

original: dper na zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
translated: For example is an example.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dod chags dang ldan pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dod chags dang ldan pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: “He is not free from attachment” is the probandum.

original: ser skya la sogs pa ni chos can no //
analyzed: ser skya la sogs pa ni chos can no //
translated: The Sāṃkhya and so on are the subjects.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa ni thob pa thog ma kho na bdag gir byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa ni thob pa thog ma kho na bdag gir byed pa'o //
translated: Possession is the initial acquisition of something.

original: bdag gir byas pa'i rjes la zhen pa'i ser skya gang yin pa de ni kun du 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gir byas pa'i rjes la zhen pa'i ser skya gang yin pa de ni kun du 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The Sāṃkhya who is attached to what he has acquired is one who clings to it.

original: yongs su 'dzin cing kun du 'dzin pa de gnyis dang lnga pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin cing kun du 'dzin pa de gnyis dang lnga pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of these two, possession and clinging, he is one who possesses five.

original: ser skya la sogs pa thob pa rnams bdag gir byed pa la /
analyzed: ser skya la sogs pa thob pa rnams bdag gir byed pa la /
translated: The Sāṃkhya and so on who have acquired something make it their own.

original: bdag gir byas pa rnams mi gtong bas de 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan @90a * //
analyzed: bdag gir byas pa rnams mi gtong bas de 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan @90a * //
translated: Because they do not give up what they have made their own, it is evident that they are attached to it and so on.

original: par mngon no //
analyzed: par mngon no //
translated: This is the reasoning.

original: tshad ma 'di chos dang mi mthun pa'i dpe ni gang du bsgrub par bya ba med na sgrub par byed pa med par bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: tshad ma 'di chos dang mi mthun pa'i dpe ni gang du bsgrub par bya ba med na sgrub par byed pa med par bstan par bya ste /
translated: An example that is not concordant with the property is one in which the absence of the probandum is shown to entail the absence of the proof.

original: gang zhig 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni bsgrub par bya ba med par rjes su brjod nas /
analyzed: gang zhig 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni bsgrub par bya ba med par rjes su brjod nas /
translated: One who is free from attachment is not an object of attainment, having stated the object of attainment,

original: de ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang kun du 'dzin pa med de zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa med par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang kun du 'dzin pa med de zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa med par sgrub pa'o //
translated: he does not grasp and cling is the proof of the absence of a means of attainment.

original: dper na khyu mchog la sogs pa lta bu ste zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //🔽bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: dper na khyu mchog la sogs pa lta bu ste zhes bya ba ni dpe'o // bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: The example is for example, a bull, etc.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa nyid dang / sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa nyid dang / sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: The object of attainment is not being free from attachment. The means of attainment is grasping and clinging.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa dang / kun du 'dzin pa dang / khyu mchog la sogs pa'i dpe de dag las ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin te /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa dang / kun du 'dzin pa dang / khyu mchog la sogs pa'i dpe de dag las ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin te /
translated: From those examples of a bull, etc., there is doubt about the opposite.

original: khyu mchog la sogs pa ni yongs su 'dzin cing kun du 'dzin pa dang mi ldan par yang the tshom za ba yin la /
analyzed: khyu mchog la sogs pa ni yongs su 'dzin cing kun du 'dzin pa dang mi ldan par yang the tshom za ba yin la /
translated: One doubts whether a bull, etc., is not endowed with grasping and clinging, and

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba yang the tshom za ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba yang the tshom za ba yin te /
translated: one doubts whether one is free from attachment.

original: khyed kyi gzhung gis 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med par 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: khyed kyi gzhung gis 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med par 'byung mod kyi /
translated: Your treatise asserts that one who is free from attachment and who is without appropriation does arise,

original: 'on kyang the tshom za ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang the tshom za ba kho na yin no //
translated: but it is only a matter of doubt.

original: gzhan yang dpe gsum pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang dpe gsum pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to demonstrate a third example,

original: gang la ldog pa med pa de ni ldog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gang la ldog pa med pa de ni ldog pa med pa'o //
translated: he says, “That which does not cease does not cease.”

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: The probandum is that one who is not free from attachment, etc.

original: smra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: smra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The reason is, “because of speaking.”

original: 'dir ldog pa bstan pa ni gang la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba nyid med pa zhes bya bas bsgrub par bya ba med par rjes su brjod na de ni smra ba ma yin te zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa sgrub ste /
analyzed: 'dir ldog pa bstan pa ni gang la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba nyid med pa zhes bya bas bsgrub par bya ba med par rjes su brjod na de ni smra ba ma yin te zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa sgrub ste /
translated: Here, the demonstration of the counter-pervasion is as follows: If one asserts the absence of the probandum, “that which is not free from attachment,” then one is not a speaker. This proves the absence of the probandum.

original: de bas na sgrub par byed pa med pas ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa la khyab pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na sgrub par byed pa med pas ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa la khyab pa bstan to //
translated: Therefore, since there is no proof, the pervasion of the absence of the probandum is demonstrated.

original: rdo'i dum bu bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe'i //
analyzed: rdo'i dum bu bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe'i //
translated: like a piece of stone. This is the example.

original: 'di ji ltar ldog pa med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar ldog pa med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is this an inconclusive reason?

original: rdo'i dum bu las ji tsam gnyi ga ldog pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo'i dum bu las ji tsam gnyi ga ldog pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both are absent from a piece of stone.

original: ci gal te rdo'i dum bu las 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid dang smra ba nyid gnyi ga log pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: ci gal te rdo'i dum bu las 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid dang smra ba nyid gnyi ga log pa yin mod kyi /
translated: If you say, “Granted, both being in lust and speaking are absent from a piece of stone,

original: 'on kyang khyab pa ldog pa gang yin pa de ma grub pa'i phyir 'di ni ldog pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang khyab pa ldog pa gang yin pa de ma grub pa'i phyir 'di ni ldog pa med pa yin no //
translated: nevertheless, the pervasion is not established, so this is an inconclusive reason.”

original: khyab pa yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: khyab pa yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is the pervasion?

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad ces bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “all those free from lust,”

original: bsgrub par bya ba med par brjod nas smra ba ma yin no zhes bya bas sgrub par byed pa med par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med par brjod nas smra ba ma yin no zhes bya bas sgrub par byed pa med par ston pa yin no //
translated: and by saying, “one does not speak without a probandum,” he shows that there is no probans without a probandum.

original: @90b de bas na bsgrub par bya ba med pa ni sgrub par byed pa med pa las nges par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: @90b de bas na bsgrub par bya ba med pa ni sgrub par byed pa med pa las nges par bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the absence of the probandum is ascertained from the absence of the probans.

original: 'di 'dra ba ni khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba ni khyab pa yin no //
translated: This is the kind of pervasion that is meant.

original: des na ldog pa de ma grub pa'i don 'di grub par bya ba'i phyir dpe yin na /
analyzed: des na ldog pa de ma grub pa'i don 'di grub par bya ba'i phyir dpe yin na /
translated: Therefore, if the example is for the purpose of establishing the meaning of the non-establishment of that reversal,

original: de ni rang gi bya ba mi byed pa'i phyir dpe'i nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rang gi bya ba mi byed pa'i phyir dpe'i nyes pa yin no //
translated: then that is a fault of the example because it does not perform its own function.

original: gang du ldog pa rab tu ma bstan pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang du ldog pa rab tu ma bstan pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: This is said of that where the reversal is not taught.

original: sgra mi rtag ste zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra mi rtag ste zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: As for sound is impermanent, impermanence is what is to be established.

original: byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: As for because it is produced, that is the reason.

original: nam mkha' bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos dang mi mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos dang mi mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
translated: As for like space, that is an example that is discordant with the property.

original: 'dir gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i tshe gzhan la don de khong du chud par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i tshe gzhan la don de khong du chud par bya ba yin la /
translated: Here, when inferring for the sake of others, the other person's understanding of that meaning is what is to be established.

original: de rang dag tu zin kyang ci ste pha rol pos ma dag par brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de rang dag tu zin kyang ci ste pha rol pos ma dag par brjod pa ste /
translated: Even though that is already understood by oneself, if the opponent states it incorrectly,

original: de ni ji ltar brjod pa de ltar ni rigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni ji ltar brjod pa de ltar ni rigs pa ma yin la /
translated: then it is not reasonable for it to be just as stated.

original: ji ltar rigs pa de ltar ni ma brjod kyi gtan tshigs ni brjod de /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa de ltar ni ma brjod kyi gtan tshigs ni brjod de /
translated: However, it is not stated just as it is reasonable, but the reason is stated.

original: de bas na gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa la smras pas nyas pa'i phyir gtan tshigs sam dpe'i nyes pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa la smras pas nyas pa'i phyir gtan tshigs sam dpe'i nyes pa yang yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the fault is stated in the inference of another, it is also a fault of the reason or example.

original: 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba las bsgrub par bya ba khong du chud pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba las bsgrub par bya ba khong du chud pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Although the probandum is not understood from the similar and dissimilar instances,

original: 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba nges pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba nges pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: nevertheless, the reason is ascertained by the probandum.

original: de bas na bsgrub par bya ba nges pa'i gtan tshigs ni rjes su 'gro ba ldog pa'i tshig gis brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bsgrub par bya ba nges pa'i gtan tshigs ni rjes su 'gro ba ldog pa'i tshig gis brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the reason that ascertains the probandum should be stated by the words of positive and negative concomitance.

original: de ltar ma yin na khong du chud par byed pa'i smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na khong du chud par byed pa'i smras pa ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, it is not stated to bring about understanding.

original: de de bzhin du bstan pa ni dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de de bzhin du bstan pa ni dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya'o //
translated: That is taught in the same way by means of an example.

original: de bas na dpe zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i tshig gi don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dpe zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i tshig gi don bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, what is called an example is the teaching of the meaning of the words of positive and negative concomitance.

original: 'dir ni ldog pa'i tshig ma sbyar bas de bas na chos dan mi mthun pa'i dpe smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir ni ldog pa'i tshig ma sbyar bas de bas na chos dan mi mthun pa'i dpe smras pa /
translated: Here, since the words of negative concomitance are not applied, therefore an example of dissimilar nature is stated.

original: mi 'dra ba tsam gyi sgo nas grub par byed pa bstan pa de lta bu ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba tsam gyi sgo nas grub par byed pa bstan pa de lta bu ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: But such a proof is not a proof, because it does not show the positive concomitance.

original: ldog pa yul gyi sgo nas ni sgrub par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: ldog pa yul gyi sgo nas ni sgrub par byed pa yin la /
translated: The proof is by the negative concomitance,

original: de bzhin du ni ma bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni ma bstan to //
translated: but that is not shown.

original: de bas na ldog pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na ldog pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the negative concomitance is shown,

original: smra ba po'i skyon gyis nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: smra ba po'i skyon gyis nyes pa yin no //
translated: but the fault is due to the speaker.

original: gang gi tshe bsgrub par bya ba yin pa de'i tshe bsgrub par bya ba med pa sgrub par byed pa med pa la nges pa ni ldog pa'i tshig las bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bsgrub par bya ba yin pa de'i tshe bsgrub par bya ba med pa sgrub par byed pa med pa la nges pa ni ldog pa'i tshig las bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: When it is the probandum, then the certainty of the absence of the probans in the absence of the probandum is shown by the words of the negative concomitance.

original: de ltar na ni gtan tshigs las bsgrub par bya ba'i nges pa bstan pa yin no //🔽ci ste bsgrub par bya ba med pa ni sgrub par byed pa med pa la nges pa yin par ma bstan na ni sgrub par byed pa yod @91a * //
analyzed: de ltar na ni gtan tshigs las bsgrub par bya ba'i nges pa bstan pa yin no // ci ste bsgrub par bya ba med pa ni sgrub par byed pa med pa la nges pa yin par ma bstan na ni sgrub par byed pa yod @91a * //
translated: Thus, the certainty of the probandum from the probans is shown.🔽But if the absence of the probandum is not shown to be certain in the absence of the probans, then it would be possible that the probans exists

original: du zin kyang bsgrub par bya ba med pa yin par srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du zin kyang bsgrub par bya ba med pa yin par srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: even though the probandum is absent.

original: de lta na ni sgrub par byed pa la bsgrub par bya ba nges pa yin par grags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni sgrub par byed pa la bsgrub par bya ba nges pa yin par grags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then it would not be well known that the probandum is ascertained in the proof.

original: de bas na bsgrub par bya ba med pa ni sgrub par byed pa med pa la nges pa yin par brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de bas na bsgrub par bya ba med pa ni sgrub par byed pa med pa la nges pa yin par brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, it must be said that the absence of the probandum is ascertained in the absence of the proof.

original: ldog pa phyin ci log ni sgrub par byed pa med pa la nges par bstan gyi /
analyzed: ldog pa phyin ci log ni sgrub par byed pa med pa la nges par bstan gyi /
translated: The opposite of the pervasion is taught to be the ascertainment of the absence of the proof.

original: bsgrub par bya ba med pa ni sgrub par byed pa med pa nges pa yin par ma bstan no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med pa ni sgrub par byed pa med pa nges pa yin par ma bstan no //
translated: But the absence of the probandum is not taught to be the ascertainment of the absence of the proof.

original: 'di ltar gang ma byas pa zhes bya bas sgrub par byed pa med pa rjes su brjod nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang ma byas pa zhes bya bas sgrub par byed pa med pa rjes su brjod nas /
translated: Thus, by the phrase “that which is not produced,” the absence of the proof is stated.

original: de ni rtag pa ste zhes bya bas bsgrub par bya ba med pa bstan to /
analyzed: de ni rtag pa ste zhes bya bas bsgrub par bya ba med pa bstan to /
translated: Then, by the phrase “that is permanent,” the absence of the probandum is stated.

original: de bas na don 'di yin te /
analyzed: de bas na don 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning.

original: ma byas pa ni rtag pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: ma byas pa ni rtag pa kho na yin la /
translated: That which is not produced is only permanent.

original: de lta yin gyi ma byas pa nyid ni rtag pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba med pa la nges pa yin pa bstan gyi /
analyzed: de lta yin gyi ma byas pa nyid ni rtag pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba med pa la nges pa yin pa bstan gyi /
translated: Thus, the absence of the probandum, “being permanent,” is ascertained in the absence of the proof, “being not produced.”

original: rtag pa nyid sgrub par byed pa med pa la ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid sgrub par byed pa med pa la ma yin no //
translated: but not in the absence of a proof of eternality.

original: de bas na bsgrub par bya ba nges pa'i gtan tshigs ldog pa'i tshig smras pa yin no ;
analyzed: de bas na bsgrub par bya ba nges pa'i gtan tshigs ldog pa'i tshig smras pa yin no ;
translated: Therefore, the words of the counter-reversal of the proof of the probandum are stated.

original: / de lta bu ldog pa'i phyin ci log kyang smra ba pos nyes pa'i phyir nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: / de lta bu ldog pa'i phyin ci log kyang smra ba pos nyes pa'i phyir nyes pa yin no //
translated: Even if there is a counter-reversal like that, it is a fault because of the fault of the speaker.

original: dpe'i skyon gyi dpe bstan nas /
analyzed: dpe'i skyon gyi dpe bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the fault of the example,

original: nyes pa nyid kyi rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyes pa nyid kyi rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the cause of the fault itself,

original: dpe ltar snang ba dag gis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dpe ltar snang ba dag gis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says by means of apparent examples.

original: bsgrub par bya ba nges pa'i gtan tshigs bstan par bya ba'i phyir dpe brjod par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba nges pa'i gtan tshigs bstan par bya ba'i phyir dpe brjod par bya ba yin na /
translated: If an example should be stated in order to teach the proof of the probandum,

original: de dag gis ni gtan tshigs spyi'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la med pa de nges par bstan mi nus so //
analyzed: de dag gis ni gtan tshigs spyi'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la med pa de nges par bstan mi nus so //
translated: they are unable to definitely teach the general characteristic of the reason, which is existing only in the similar class and not existing in any dissimilar class.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni bye brag rtogs pa nyid kyis khong du chud par bya ba yin /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni bye brag rtogs pa nyid kyis khong du chud par bya ba yin /
translated: The general characteristic is to be understood by the realization of the particulars.

original: rang gi ni ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi ni ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is not the universal the object of the word?

original: bye brag gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bye brag gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The word “particular” is mentioned.

original: ci ste bye brag gi mtshan nyid khong du chud par nus pa ni ci'i mtshan nyid kyang rtogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste bye brag gi mtshan nyid khong du chud par nus pa ni ci'i mtshan nyid kyang rtogs par 'gyur na /
translated: If one can understand the particular characteristic, then one can also understand the universal characteristic.

original: bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyang de dag gis rtogs par mi nus so //
analyzed: bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyang de dag gis rtogs par mi nus so //
translated: But they cannot understand the particular characteristic.

original: de bas na don gyi dbang gi shugs kyis de dag gsal bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na don gyi dbang gi shugs kyis de dag gsal bar rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the universal should be understood by implication from the particular.

original: bsgrub par bya ba nges pa'i sgrub par byed pa grags pa blang bar bya ba yin na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba nges pa'i sgrub par byed pa grags pa blang bar bya ba yin na /
translated: If the well-known proof of the probandum is to be accepted,

original: de mi nus pa'i phyir nyes pa yin te /
analyzed: de mi nus pa'i phyir nyes pa yin te /
translated: then it is a fault because it is not possible.

original: rang gi bya ba mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi bya ba mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not perform its own function.

original: nus pa 'di tsam gyis sgrub par byed pa med par smras zin to //
analyzed: nus pa 'di tsam gyis sgrub par byed pa med par smras zin to //
translated: This much is possible, but it has already been said that there is no proof.

original: sun 'byin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the refutation,

original: sun 'byin pa lta ba ni ma tshang ba nyid la sogs @91b pa'i smras pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa lta ba ni ma tshang ba nyid la sogs @91b pa'i smras pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, “The refutation is stated as incompleteness, etc.”

original: smras pa 'dis brjod par bya ba'i phyir tshig la smras pa zhes bya'o //🔽ma tshang ba nyid la sogs pa'i tshig sun 'byin pa yin par bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: smras pa 'dis brjod par bya ba'i phyir tshig la smras pa zhes bya'o // ma tshang ba nyid la sogs pa'i tshig sun 'byin pa yin par bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: Reply: The term statement is used for the expression of what is to be expressed.

original: gang sngar zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang sngar zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it explains the refutation of the expression of incompleteness, etc., he says, That which was previously stated.

original: ma tshang ba dang / ma grub pa dang / 'gal ba dang / ma nges pa bstan pa de dag brjod pa'i tshig gang yin pa de dag ni sun 'byin pa yin no //
analyzed: ma tshang ba dang / ma grub pa dang / 'gal ba dang / ma nges pa bstan pa de dag brjod pa'i tshig gang yin pa de dag ni sun 'byin pa yin no //
translated: That which was previously stated is the teaching of incompleteness, nonestablishment, contradiction, and inconclusiveness. The words that express those are refutations.

original: ma tshang ba nyid la sogs pa'i phyin ci log tu sgrub par mi byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ma tshang ba nyid la sogs pa'i phyin ci log tu sgrub par mi byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: But are not incompleteness, etc., established as fallacies?

original: de ji ltar sun 'byin pa yin zhe na /🔽smras pa ma tshang ba nyid la sogs pa'i pha rol po'i 'dod pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de ji ltar sun 'byin pa yin zhe na / smras pa ma tshang ba nyid la sogs pa'i pha rol po'i 'dod pa yang yin la /
translated: How then are they refutations?

original: don kyang yin pa des nges par grub pa la gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don kyang yin pa des nges par grub pa la gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Reply: Incompleteness, etc., are the opponent's assertions and also the meaning. Because they obstruct the establishment of the meaning,🔽 they are refutations.

original: 'gal ba bzhin du gdon mi za bar phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa kho na'i phyir sun 'byin pa yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'gal ba bzhin du gdon mi za bar phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa kho na'i phyir sun 'byin pa yang ma yin gyi /
translated: They are not refutations only because they necessarily establish the opposite, like contradiction.

original: 'on kyang pha rol po'i 'dod pa nges pa la gegs byed pa'i phyir ram /🔽nges pa med par byed pa yang yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang pha rol po'i 'dod pa nges pa la gegs byed pa'i phyir ram / nges pa med par byed pa yang yin te /
translated: But it is also a source of uncertainty, because it prevents the ascertainment of the opponent’s thesis.

original: nges pa phyin ci log tu grub pa nyid kyang yod do //
analyzed: nges pa phyin ci log tu grub pa nyid kyang yod do //
translated: It is also a source of error, because it establishes the opposite of what is to be ascertained.

original: sun 'byin pa smras zin to //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa smras zin to //
translated: Refutation has already been explained.

original: sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba ni sun 'byin pa bzhin du snang bas na sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba ni sun 'byin pa bzhin du snang bas na sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba'o //
translated: A semblance of refutation is a semblance of refutation because it appears to be a refutation.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: ltag chod do zhes bya ba'o //🔽ltag chod kyi sgra ni lan dang 'dra ba la ltag chod ces bya ba ste /🔽lan gyi gnas su rab tu sbyar ba'i phyir lan dang 'dra ba ni ltag chod yin no //
analyzed: ltag chod do zhes bya ba'o // ltag chod kyi sgra ni lan dang 'dra ba la ltag chod ces bya ba ste / lan gyi gnas su rab tu sbyar ba'i phyir lan dang 'dra ba ni ltag chod yin no //
translated: They are: quibble,🔽The term quibble is a synonym for answer.🔽It is a quibble because it is applied in place of an answer.

original: lan dang 'dra ba de nyid lan gyi gnas su rab tu sbyar ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lan dang 'dra ba de nyid lan gyi gnas su rab tu sbyar ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that a quibble is applied in place of an answer, he says:

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa mi bden pa'i skyon brjod pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa mi bden pa'i skyon brjod pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The expression of a fault that is not real and not true.

original: tshig 'dis brjod pas na brjod pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'dis brjod pas na brjod pa'o //
translated: It is an expression because it is expressed by this word.

original: de ni lan yin te /
analyzed: de ni lan yin te /
translated: That is an answer.

original: lan dang 'dra ba'i ltag chod ni ltag chod rnams yin no //
analyzed: lan dang 'dra ba'i ltag chod ni ltag chod rnams yin no //
translated: The counter-responses that are like the responses are the counter-responses.

original: rigs pa'i thigs pa'i tshig gi dngos po cung zad bshad pa yis //
analyzed: rigs pa'i thigs pa'i tshig gi dngos po cung zad bshad pa yis //
translated: By explaining a little of the words and things of the Drop of Logic,

original: zla nyi lta bu'i dge ba dri med bdag gis gang thob pa //
analyzed: zla nyi lta bu'i dge ba dri med bdag gis gang thob pa //
translated: Whatever stainless virtue I have obtained, like the moon and sun,

original: ye shes chos mchog gang yin rga med go 'phang 'thob gyur nas //
analyzed: ye shes chos mchog gang yin rga med go 'phang 'thob gyur nas //
translated: Having attained the state of wisdom, the supreme Dharma, which is ageless,

original: de phyir bdag ni 'gro la phan pa 'ba' zhig byed par shog //
analyzed: de phyir bdag ni 'gro la phan pa 'ba' zhig byed par shog //
translated: Therefore, may I be one who only acts to benefit the world.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis yongs rtsis na ;
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis yongs rtsis na ;
translated: When fully counted by the wise,🔽The verses have a thousand words,

original: / tshig bcad rnams ni tshig stong dang // de bzhin brgya phrag bzhi dag dang // bdun cu rtsa bdun rab tu ldan //
analyzed: / tshig bcad rnams ni tshig stong dang // de bzhin brgya phrag bzhi dag dang // bdun cu rtsa bdun rab tu ldan //
translated: And likewise, four hundred and seventy-seven.

original: rigs pa'i thigs pa zhes bya ba'i rab tu byed pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon chos mchog gis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rigs pa'i thigs pa zhes bya ba'i rab tu byed pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon chos mchog gis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the extensive treatise called The Drop of Logic is completed.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzny'a na @92a * //
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzny'a na @92a * //
translated: The Indian abbot Jñānadhara

original: garbha dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba dge slong dharma a'a lo kas bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa /
analyzed: garbha dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba dge slong dharma a'a lo kas bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa /
